BitField.name: MPROT5
BitField.description: Master 5 Priviledge, Buffer, Read, Write Control.

Enum.name: MPL0
Enum.description: Accesses from this master are forced to user-mode (ips_supervisor_access is forced to zero) regardless of the hprot[1] access attribute.

Enum.name: MPL1
Enum.description: Accesses from this master are not forced to user-mode. The hprot[1] access attribute is used directly to determine ips_supervisor_access.

Enum.name: TP0
Enum.description: Accesses from an untrusted master are allowed.

Enum.name: TP1
Enum.description: Accesses from an untrusted master are not allowed. If an access is attempted by an untrusted master, the access is terminated with an error response and no peripheral access is initiated on the IPS bus.

BitField.name: PWD_ZCD
BitField.description: power down the zero cross detection function for discontinuous conductor mode

BitField.name: DISABLE_AUTO_CLK_SWITCH
BitField.description: Disable automatic clock switch from internal osc to xtal clock.

BitField.name: SEL_CLK
BitField.description: select 24 MHz Crystal clock for DCDC, when dcdc_disable_auto_clk_switch is set.

BitField.name: PWD_OSC_INT
BitField.description: Power down internal osc. Only set this bit, when 24 MHz crystal osc is available

BitField.name: PWD_CUR_SNS_CMP
BitField.description: The power down signal of the current detector.

BitField.name: CUR_SNS_THRSH
BitField.description: Set the threshold of current detector, if the peak current of the inductor exceeds the threshold, the current detector will assert

BitField.name: OVERCUR_TRIG_ADJ
BitField.description: The threshold of over current detection in run mode and power save mode: run mode power save mode 0x0 1 A 0

BitField.name: PWD_CMP_BATT_DET
BitField.description: set to "1" to power down the low voltage detection comparator

BitField.name: EN_LP_OVERLOAD_SNS
BitField.description: enable the overload detection in power save mode, if current is larger than the overloading threshold (typical value is 50 mA), DCDC will switch to the run mode automatically

BitField.name: LP_OVERLOAD_THRSH
BitField.description: the threshold of the counting number of charging times during the period that lp_overload_freq_sel sets in power save mode

BitField.name: LP_OVERLOAD_FREQ_SEL
BitField.description: the period of counting the charging times in power save mode 0: eight 32k cycle 1: sixteen 32k cycle

BitField.name: LP_HIGH_HYS
BitField.description: Adjust hysteretic value in low power from 12.5mV to 25mV

BitField.name: XTALOK_DISABLE
BitField.description: 1'b1: Disable xtalok detection circuit 1'b0: Enable xtalok detection circuit

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_OK
BitField.description: set to 1 to switch internal ring osc to xtal 24M

BitField.name: STS_DC_OK
BitField.description: Status register to indicate DCDC status. 1'b1: DCDC already settled 1'b0: DCDC is settling

BitField.name: REG_FBK_SEL
BitField.description: select the feedback point of the internal regulator

BitField.name: REG_RLOAD_SW
BitField.description: control the load resistor of the internal regulator of DCDC, the load resistor is connected as default "1", and need set to "0" to disconnect the load resistor

BitField.name: LP_CMP_ISRC_SEL
BitField.description: set the current bias of low power comparator 0x0: 50 nA 0x1: 100 nA 0x2: 200 nA 0x3: 400 nA

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_HST_THRESH
BitField.description: increase the threshold detection for common mode analog comparator

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_EN_HYST
BitField.description: Enable hysteresis in switching converter common mode analog comparators

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_DC_C
BitField.description: Ratio of integral control parameter to proportional control parameter in the switching DC-DC converter, and can be used to optimize efficiency and loop response

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_DC_R
BitField.description: Magnitude of proportional control parameter in the switching DC-DC converter control loop.

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_DC_FF
BitField.description: Two's complement feed forward step in duty cycle in the switching DC-DC converter

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_EN_RCSCALE
BitField.description: Enable analog circuit of DC-DC converter to respond faster under transient load conditions.

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_RCSCALE_THRSH
BitField.description: Increase the threshold detection for RC scale circuit.

BitField.name: LOOPCTRL_HYST_SIGN
BitField.description: Invert the sign of the hysteresis in DC-DC analog comparators.

BitField.name: BATTMONITOR_EN_BATADJ
BitField.description: This bit enables the DC-DC to improve efficiency and minimize ripple using the information from the BATT_VAL field

BitField.name: DISABLE_PULSE_SKIP
BitField.description: Set to "0" : stop charging if the duty cycle is lower than what set by dcdc_neglimit_in

BitField.name: DCM_SET_CTRL
BitField.description: Set high to improve the transition from heavy load to light load

BitField.name: TRG
BitField.description: Target value of VDD_SOC, 25 mV each step 0x0: 0.8V 0xE: 1.15V 0x1F:1.575V

BitField.name: TARGET_LP
BitField.description: Target value of standby (low power) mode 0x0: 0

BitField.name: MINPWR_DC_HALFCLK
BitField.description: Set DCDC clock to half freqeuncy for continuous mode

BitField.name: MISC_DELAY_TIMING
BitField.description: Ajust delay to reduce ground noise

BitField.name: DISABLE_STEP
BitField.description: Disable stepping for the output VDD_SOC of DCDC

Enum.name: FRZ_0
Enum.description: Timers continue to run in Debug mode.

Enum.name: FRZ_1
Enum.description: Timers are stopped in Debug mode.

Enum.name: MDIS_0
Enum.description: Clock for standard PIT timers is enabled.

Enum.name: MDIS_1
Enum.description: Clock for standard PIT timers is disabled.

Enum.name: TEN_0
Enum.description: Timer n is disabled.

Enum.name: TEN_1
Enum.description: Timer n is enabled.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt requests from Timer n are disabled.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt is requested whenever TIF is set.

Enum.name: CHN_0
Enum.description: Timer is not chained.

Enum.name: CHN_1
Enum.description: Timer is chained to a previous timer. For example, for channel 2, if this field is set, Timer 2 is chained to Timer 1.

Enum.name: TIF_0
Enum.description: Timeout has not yet occurred.

Enum.name: TIF_1
Enum.description: Timeout has occurred.

BitField.name: EXT0_TRIG_ENABLE
BitField.description: TSC0 TRIG enable register. 1'b1: enable external TSC0 trigger. 1'b0: disable external TSC0 trigger.

BitField.name: EXT0_TRIG_PRIORITY
BitField.description: External TSC0 trigger priority, 7 is Highest, 0 is lowest .

BitField.name: EXT1_TRIG_ENABLE
BitField.description: TSC1 TRIG enable register. 1'b1: enable external TSC1 trigger. 1'b0: disable external TSC1 trigger.

BitField.name: EXT1_TRIG_PRIORITY
BitField.description: External TSC1 trigger priority, 7 is Highest, 0 is lowest .

BitField.name: PRE_DIVIDER
BitField.description: Pre-divider for trig delay and interval .

BitField.name: DMA_MODE_SEL
BitField.description: 1'b0: Trig DMA_REQ with latched signal, REQ will be cleared when ACK and source request cleared

BitField.name: TSC_BYPASS
BitField.description: 1'b1: TSC is bypassed to ADC2. 1'b0: TSC not bypassed. To use ADC2, this bit should be cleared.

BitField.name: SOFTRST
BitField.description: Software reset, high active. When write 1 ,all logical will be reset.

Register.name: DONE0_1_IRQ
Register.description: ETC DONE0 and DONE1 IRQ State Register

Register.name: DONE2_ERR_IRQ
Register.description: ETC DONE_2 and DONE_ERR IRQ State Register

BitField.name: SW_TRIG
BitField.description: Software write 1 as the TRIGGER. This register is self-clearing.

BitField.name: TRIG_MODE
BitField.description: TRIG mode register. 1'b0: hardware trigger. 1'b1: software trigger.

BitField.name: TRIG_CHAIN
BitField.description: TRIG chain length to the ADC. 0: Trig length is 1; ... 7: Trig length is 8;

BitField.name: TRIG_PRIORITY
BitField.description: External trigger priority, 7 is highest, 0 is lowest .

BitField.name: SYNC_MODE
BitField.description: TRIG mode control . 1'b0: Disable sync mode; 1'b1: Enable sync mode

BitField.name: CHAINx_DONE
BitField.description: CHAINx done interrupt detection bit 0: CHAIN0 done interrupt bit 1: CHAIN1 done interrupt bit 2: CHAIN2 done interrupt bit 3: CHAIN3 done interrupt bit 4: CHAIN4 done interrupt bit 5: CHAIN5 done interrupt bit 6: CHAIN6 done interrupt bit 7: CHAIN7 done interrupt The done interrupts are cleared by writing a logic 1 to the bits

BitField.name: HWTS0
BitField.description: CHAIN0 HWTS ADC hardware trigger selection. For more information, see the ADC chapter.

BitField.name: B2B0
BitField.description: CHAIN0 B2B 1'b0: Disable B2B, wait until interval is reached 1'b1: Enable B2B, back to back ADC trigger

BitField.name: IE0
BitField.description: CHAIN0 IE 2'b00: Finished Interrupt on Done0 2'b01: Finished Interrupt on Done1 2'b10: Finished Interrupt on Done2 2'b11: Finished Interrupt on Done3

BitField.name: HWTS1
BitField.description: CHAIN1 HWTS ADC hardware trigger selection. For more information, see the ADC chapter.

BitField.name: B2B1
BitField.description: CHAIN1 B2B 1'b0: Disable B2B, wait until interval is reached 1'b1: Enable B2B, back to back ADC trigger

BitField.name: IE1
BitField.description: CHAIN1 IE 2'b00: Finished Interrupt on Done0 2'b01: Finished Interrupt on Done1 2'b10: Finished Interrupt on Done2 2'b11: Finished Interrupt on Done3

Enum.name: IEN0_1

Enum.description: STS0 never asserts

Enum.name: EDGE0_1
Enum.description: STS0 asserts on rising edges of XBAR_OUT0

Enum.name: EDGE0_2

BitField.name: RXCLKSRC
BitField.description: Sample Clock source selection for Flash Reading

Enum.name: RXCLKSRC_0
Enum.description: Dummy Read strobe generated by FlexSPI Controller and loopback internally.

Enum.name: RXCLKSRC_1
Enum.description: Dummy Read strobe generated by FlexSPI Controller and loopback from DQS pad.

Enum.name: RXCLKSRC_3
Enum.description: Flash provided Read strobe and input from DQS pad

BitField.name: ARDFEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus Read Access to IP RX FIFO.

Enum.name: ARDFEN_0
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO should be read by IP Bus. AHB Bus read access to IP RX FIFO memory space will get bus error response.

Enum.name: ARDFEN_1
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO should be read by AHB Bus. IP Bus read access to IP RX FIFO memory space will always return data zero but no bus error response.

BitField.name: ATDFEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus Write Access to IP TX FIFO.

Enum.name: ATDFEN_0
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO should be written by IP Bus. AHB Bus write access to IP TX FIFO memory space will get bus error response.

Enum.name: ATDFEN_1
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO should be written by AHB Bus. IP Bus write access to IP TX FIFO memory space will be ignored but no bus error response.

BitField.name: SERCLKDIV
BitField.description: The serial root clock could be divided inside FlexSPI . Refer Clocks chapter for more details on clocking.

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_0
Enum.description: Divided by 1

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_1
Enum.description: Divided by 2

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_2
Enum.description: Divided by 3

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_3
Enum.description: Divided by 4

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_4
Enum.description: Divided by 5

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_5
Enum.description: Divided by 6

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_6
Enum.description: Divided by 7

Enum.name: SERCLKDIV_7
Enum.description: Divided by 8

BitField.name: HSEN
BitField.description: Half Speed Serial Flash access Enable.

Enum.name: HSEN_0
Enum.description: Disable divide by 2 of serial flash clock for half speed commands.

Enum.name: HSEN_1
Enum.description: Enable divide by 2 of serial flash clock for half speed commands.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: Doze mode support disabled. AHB clock and serial clock will not be gated off when there is doze mode request from system.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: Doze mode support enabled. AHB clock and serial clock will be gated off when there is doze mode request from system.

BitField.name: COMBINATIONEN
BitField.description: This bit is to support Flash Octal mode access by combining Port A and B Data pins (A_DATA[3:0] and B_DATA[3:0]).

BitField.name: SCKFREERUNEN
BitField.description: This bit is used to force SCLK output free-running. For FPGA applications, external device may use SCLK as reference clock to its internal PLL. If SCLK free-running is enabled, data sampling with loopback clock from SCLK pad is not supported (MCR0[RXCLKSRC]=2).

BitField.name: IPGRANTWAIT
BitField.description: Time out wait cycle for IP command grant.

BitField.name: AHBGRANTWAIT
BitField.description: Timeout wait cycle for AHB command grant.

BitField.name: AHBBUSWAIT
BitField.description: AHB Read/Write access to Serial Flash Memory space will timeout if not data received from Flash or data not transmitted after AHBBUSWAIT * 1024 ahb clock cycles, AHB Bus will get an error response

BitField.name: SEQWAIT
BitField.description: Command Sequence Execution will timeout and abort after SEQWAIT * 1024 Serial Root Clock cycles

BitField.name: CLRAHBBUFOPT
BitField.description: This bit determines whether AHB RX Buffer and AHB TX Buffer will be cleaned automatically when FlexSPI returns STOP mode ACK. Software should set this bit if AHB RX Buffer or AHB TX Buffer will be powered off in STOP mode. Otherwise AHB read access after exiting STOP mode may hit AHB RX Buffer or AHB TX Buffer but their data entries are invalid.

Enum.name: CLRAHBBUFOPT_0
Enum.description: AHB RX/TX Buffer will not be cleaned automatically when FlexSPI return Stop mode ACK.

Enum.name: CLRAHBBUFOPT_1
Enum.description: AHB RX/TX Buffer will be cleaned automatically when FlexSPI return Stop mode ACK.

BitField.name: CLRLEARNPHASE
BitField.description: The sampling clock phase selection will be reset to phase 0 when this bit is written with 0x1. This bit will be auto-cleared immediately.

BitField.name: SAMEDEVICEEN
BitField.description: All external devices are same devices (both in types and size) for A1/A2/B1/B2.

Enum.name: SAMEDEVICEEN_0
Enum.description: In Individual mode, FLSHA1CRx/FLSHA2CRx/FLSHB1CRx/FLSHB2CRx register setting will be applied to Flash A1/A2/B1/B2 separately. In Parallel mode, FLSHA1CRx register setting will be applied to Flash A1 and B1, FLSHA2CRx register setting will be applied to Flash A2 and B2. FLSHB1CRx/FLSHB2CRx register settings will be ignored.

Enum.name: SAMEDEVICEEN_1
Enum.description: FLSHA1CR0/FLSHA1CR1/FLSHA1CR2 register settings will be applied to Flash A1/A2/B1/B2. FLSHA2CRx/FLSHB1CRx/FLSHB2CRx will be ignored.

BitField.name: SCKBDIFFOPT
BitField.description: B_SCLK pad can be used as A_SCLK differential clock output (inverted clock to A_SCLK). In this case, port B flash access is not available. After changing the value of this field, MCR0[SWRESET] should be set.

Enum.name: SCKBDIFFOPT_0
Enum.description: B_SCLK pad is used as port B SCLK clock output. Port B flash access is available.

Enum.name: SCKBDIFFOPT_1
Enum.description: B_SCLK pad is used as port A SCLK inverted clock output (Differential clock to A_SCLK). Port B flash access is not available.

BitField.name: RESUMEWAIT
BitField.description: Wait cycle (in AHB clock cycle) for idle state before suspended command sequence resumed.

BitField.name: APAREN
BitField.description: Parallel mode enabled for AHB triggered Command (both read and write) .

Enum.name: APAREN_0
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Individual mode.

Enum.name: APAREN_1
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Parallel mode.

BitField.name: CLRAHBRXBUF
BitField.description: Clear the status/pointers of AHB RX Buffer. Auto-cleared.

BitField.name: CLRAHBTXBUF
BitField.description: Clear the status/pointers of AHB TX Buffer. Auto-cleared.

BitField.name: CACHABLEEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus cachable read access support.

Enum.name: CACHABLEEN_0
Enum.description: Disabled. When there is AHB bus cachable read access, FlexSPI will not check whether it hit AHB TX Buffer.

Enum.name: CACHABLEEN_1
Enum.description: Enabled. When there is AHB bus cachable read access, FlexSPI will check whether it hit AHB TX Buffer first.

BitField.name: BUFFERABLEEN
BitField.description: Enable AHB bus bufferable write access support. This field affects the last beat of AHB write access, refer for more details about AHB bufferable write.

Enum.name: BUFFERABLEEN_0
Enum.description: Disabled. For all AHB write access (no matter bufferable or non-bufferable ), FlexSPI will return AHB Bus ready after all data is transmitted to External device and AHB command finished.

Enum.name: BUFFERABLEEN_1
Enum.description: Enabled. For AHB bufferable write access, FlexSPI will return AHB Bus ready when the AHB command is granted by arbitrator and will not wait for AHB command finished.

BitField.name: READADDROPT
BitField.description: AHB Read Address option bit. This option bit is intend to remove AHB burst start address alignment limitation.

Enum.name: READADDROPT_0
Enum.description: There is AHB read burst start address alignment limitation when flash is accessed in parallel mode or flash is wordaddressable.

Enum.name: READADDROPT_1
Enum.description: There is no AHB read burst start address alignment limitation. FlexSPI will fetch more data than AHB burst required to meet the alignment requirement.

Enum.name: READSZALIGN_0
Enum.description: AHB read size will be decided by other register setting like PREFETCH_EN,OTFAD_EN...

Enum.name: READSZALIGN_1
Enum.description: AHB read size to up size to 8 bytes aligned, no prefetching

BitField.name: IPCMDDONEEN
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Execution finished interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPCMDGEEN
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt enable.

BitField.name: AHBCMDGEEN
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPCMDERREN
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt enable.

BitField.name: AHBCMDERREN
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPRXWAEN
BitField.description: IP RX FIFO WaterMark available interrupt enable.

BitField.name: IPTXWEEN
BitField.description: IP TX FIFO WaterMark empty interrupt enable.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYRDEN
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async RX FIFO full interrupt enable.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYWREN
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async TX FIFO empty interrupt enable.

BitField.name: AHBBUSERROREN
BitField.description: AHB Bus error interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

BitField.name: SEQTIMEOUTEN
BitField.description: Sequence execution timeout interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

BitField.name: KEYDONEEN
BitField.description: OTFAD key blob processing done interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

BitField.name: KEYERROREN
BitField.description: OTFAD key blob processing error interrupt enable.Refer Interrupts chapter for more details.

BitField.name: IPCMDDONE
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Execution finished interrupt. This interrupt is also generated when there is IPCMDGE or IPCMDERR interrupt generated.

BitField.name: IPCMDGE
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt.

BitField.name: AHBCMDGE
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Grant Timeout interrupt.

BitField.name: IPCMDERR
BitField.description: IP triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt. When an error detected for IP command, this command will be ignored and not executed at all.

BitField.name: AHBCMDERR
BitField.description: AHB triggered Command Sequences Error Detected interrupt. When an error detected for AHB command, this command will be ignored and not executed at all.

BitField.name: IPRXWA
BitField.description: IP RX FIFO watermark available interrupt.

BitField.name: IPTXWE
BitField.description: IP TX FIFO watermark empty interrupt.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYRD
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async RX FIFO full interrupt.

BitField.name: SCKSTOPBYWR
BitField.description: SCLK is stopped during command sequence because Async TX FIFO empty interrupt.

BitField.name: AHBBUSERROR
BitField.description: AHB Bus timeout or AHB bus illegal access Flash during OTFAD key blob processing interrupt.

BitField.name: KEYDONE
BitField.description: OTFAD key blob processing done interrupt.

BitField.name: KEYERROR
BitField.description: OTFAD key blob processing error interrupt.

BitField.name: KEY
BitField.description: The Key to lock or unlock LUT.

BitField.name: BUFSZ
BitField.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

BitField.name: MSTRID
BitField.description: This AHB RX Buffer is assigned according to AHB Master with ID (MSTR_ID).

BitField.name: PRIORITY
BitField.description: This priority for AHB Master Read which this AHB RX Buffer is assigned. 7 is the highest priority, 0 the lowest.

BitField.name: PREFETCHEN
BitField.description: AHB Read Prefetch Enable for current AHB RX Buffer corresponding Master.

BitField.name: BUFSZ
BitField.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

BitField.name: MSTRID
BitField.description: This AHB RX Buffer is assigned according to AHB Master with ID (MSTR_ID).

BitField.name: PRIORITY
BitField.description: This priority for AHB Master Read which this AHB RX Buffer is assigned. 7 is the highest priority, 0 the lowest.

BitField.name: PREFETCHEN
BitField.description: AHB Read Prefetch Enable for current AHB RX Buffer corresponding Master.

BitField.name: BUFSZ
BitField.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

BitField.name: MSTRID
BitField.description: This AHB RX Buffer is assigned according to AHB Master with ID (MSTR_ID).

BitField.name: PRIORITY
BitField.description: This priority for AHB Master Read which this AHB RX Buffer is assigned. 7 is the highest priority, 0 the lowest.

BitField.name: PREFETCHEN
BitField.description: AHB Read Prefetch Enable for current AHB RX Buffer corresponding Master.

BitField.name: BUFSZ
BitField.description: AHB RX Buffer Size in 64 bits.

BitField.name: MSTRID
BitField.description: This AHB RX Buffer is assigned according to AHB Master with ID (MSTR_ID).

BitField.name: PRIORITY
BitField.description: This priority for AHB Master Read which this AHB RX Buffer is assigned. 7 is the highest priority, 0 the lowest.

BitField.name: PREFETCHEN
BitField.description: AHB Read Prefetch Enable for current AHB RX Buffer corresponding Master.

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_0
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 1 serial clock cycle

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_1
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 256 serial clock cycle

BitField.name: CSINTERVAL
BitField.description: This field is used to set the minimum interval between flash device Chip selection deassertion and flash device Chip selection assertion. If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_0
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 1 serial clock cycle

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_1
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 256 serial clock cycle

BitField.name: CSINTERVAL
BitField.description: This field is used to set the minimum interval between flash device Chip selection deassertion and flash device Chip selection assertion. If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_0
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 1 serial clock cycle

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_1
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 256 serial clock cycle

BitField.name: CSINTERVAL
BitField.description: This field is used to set the minimum interval between flash device Chip selection deassertion and flash device Chip selection assertion. If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_0
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 1 serial clock cycle

Enum.name: CSINTERVALUNIT_1
Enum.description: The CS interval unit is 256 serial clock cycle

BitField.name: CSINTERVAL
BitField.description: This field is used to set the minimum interval between flash device Chip selection deassertion and flash device Chip selection assertion. If external flash has a limitation on the interval between command sequences, this field should be set accordingly. If there is no limitation, set this field with value 0x0.

BitField.name: ARDSEQID
BitField.description: Sequence Index for AHB Read triggered Command in LUT.

BitField.name: ARDSEQNUM
BitField.description: Sequence Number for AHB Read triggered Command in LUT.

BitField.name: AWRSEQID
BitField.description: Sequence Index for AHB Write triggered Command.

BitField.name: AWRSEQNUM
BitField.description: Sequence Number for AHB Write triggered Command.

BitField.name: AWRWAIT
BitField.description: For certain devices (such as FPGA), it need some time to write data into internal memory after the command sequences finished on FlexSPI interface

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_0
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_1
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_2
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_3
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 128 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_4
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 512 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_5
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2048 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_6
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8192 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_7
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32768 ahb clock cycle

BitField.name: CLRINSTRPTR
BitField.description: Clear the instruction pointer which is internally saved pointer by JMP_ON_CS. Refer Programmable Sequence Engine for details.

BitField.name: ARDSEQID
BitField.description: Sequence Index for AHB Read triggered Command in LUT.

BitField.name: ARDSEQNUM

BitField.name: AWRSEQNUM

BitField.name: AWRWAIT
BitField.description: For certain devices (such as FPGA), it need some time to write data into internal memory after the command sequences finished on FlexSPI interface

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_0
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_1
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_2
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_3
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 128 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_4
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 512 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_5
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 2048 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_6
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 8192 ahb clock cycle

Enum.name: AWRWAITUNIT_7
Enum.description: The AWRWAIT unit is 32768 ahb clock cycle

BitField.name: WMOPT1
BitField.description: Write mask option bit 1. This option bit could be used to remove AHB write burst start address alignment limitation.

Enum.name: WMOPT1_0
Enum.description: DQS pin will be used as Write Mask when writing to external device. There is no limitation on AHB write burst start address alignment when flash is accessed in individual mode.

Enum.name: WMOPT1_1
Enum.description: DQS pin will not be used as Write Mask when writing to external device. There is limitation on AHB write burst start address alignment when flash is accessed in individual mode.

BitField.name: WMENA
BitField.description: Write mask enable bit for flash device on port A. When write mask function is needed for memory device on port A, this bit must be set.

Enum.name: WMENA_0
Enum.description: Write mask is disabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be un-driven when writing to external device.

Enum.name: WMENA_1
Enum.description: Write mask is enabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be driven by FlexSPI as write mask output when writing to external device.

BitField.name: WMENB
BitField.description: Write mask enable bit for flash device on port B. When write mask function is needed for memory device on port B, this bit must be set.

Enum.name: WMENB_0
Enum.description: Write mask is disabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be un-driven when writing to external device.

Enum.name: WMENB_1
Enum.description: Write mask is enabled, DQS(RWDS) pin will be driven by FlexSPI as write mask output when writing to external device.

BitField.name: SFAR
BitField.description: Serial Flash Address for IP command.

BitField.name: IDATSZ
BitField.description: Flash Read/Program Data Size (in Bytes) for IP command.

BitField.name: ISEQID
BitField.description: Sequence Index in LUT for IP command.

BitField.name: ISEQNUM
BitField.description: Sequence Number for IP command: ISEQNUM+1.

BitField.name: IPAREN
BitField.description: Parallel mode Enabled for IP command.

Enum.name: IPAREN_0
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Individual mode.

Enum.name: IPAREN_1
Enum.description: Flash will be accessed in Parallel mode.

BitField.name: TRG
BitField.description: Setting this bit will trigger an IP Command.

BitField.name: CLRIPRXF
BitField.description: Clear all valid data entries in IP RX FIFO.

BitField.name: RXDMAEN
BitField.description: IP RX FIFO reading by DMA enabled.

Enum.name: RXDMAEN_0
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO would be read by processor.

Enum.name: RXDMAEN_1
Enum.description: IP RX FIFO would be read by DMA.

BitField.name: CLRIPTXF
BitField.description: Clear all valid data entries in IP TX FIFO.

BitField.name: TXDMAEN
BitField.description: IP TX FIFO filling by DMA enabled.

Enum.name: TXDMAEN_0
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO would be filled by processor.

Enum.name: TXDMAEN_1
Enum.description: IP TX FIFO would be filled by DMA.

BitField.name: DLLRESET
BitField.description: Software could force a reset on DLL by setting this field to 0x1. This will cause the DLL to lose lock and re-calibrate to detect an ref_clock half period phase shift. The reset action is edge triggered, so software need to clear this bit after set this bit (no delay limitation).

BitField.name: SLVDLYTARGET
BitField.description: The delay target for slave delay line is: ((SLVDLYTARGET+1) * 1/32 * clock cycle of reference clock (serial root clock). If serial root clock is >= 100 MHz, DLLEN set to 0x1, OVRDEN set to =0x0, then SLVDLYTARGET setting of 0xF is recommended.

BitField.name: OVRDEN
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override enable.

BitField.name: OVRDVAL
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override value.

BitField.name: DLLRESET
BitField.description: Software could force a reset on DLL by setting this field to 0x1. This will cause the DLL to lose lock and re-calibrate to detect an ref_clock half period phase shift. The reset action is edge triggered, so software need to clear this bit after set this bit (no delay limitation).

BitField.name: SLVDLYTARGET
BitField.description: The delay target for slave delay line is: ((SLVDLYTARGET+1) * 1/32 * clock cycle of reference clock (serial root clock). If serial root clock is >= 100 MHz, DLLEN set to 0x1, OVRDEN set to =0x0, then SLVDLYTARGET setting of 0xF is recommended.

BitField.name: OVRDEN
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override enable.

BitField.name: OVRDVAL
BitField.description: Slave clock delay line delay cell number selection override value.

BitField.name: SEQIDLE
BitField.description: This status bit indicates the state machine in SEQ_CTL is idle and there is command sequence executing on FlexSPI interface.

BitField.name: ARBIDLE
BitField.description: This status bit indicates the state machine in ARB_CTL is busy and there is command sequence granted by arbitrator and not finished yet on FlexSPI interface. When ARB_CTL state (ARBIDLE=0x1) is idle, there will be no transaction on FlexSPI interface also (SEQIDLE=0x1). So this bit should be polled to wait for FlexSPI controller become idle instead of SEQIDLE.

BitField.name: ARBCMDSRC
BitField.description: This status field indicates the trigger source of current command sequence granted by arbitrator. This field value is meaningless when ARB_CTL is not busy (STS0[ARBIDLE]=0x1).

Enum.name: ARBCMDSRC_0
Enum.description: Triggered by AHB read command (triggered by AHB read).

Enum.name: ARBCMDSRC_1
Enum.description: Triggered by AHB write command (triggered by AHB Write).

Enum.name: ARBCMDSRC_2
Enum.description: Triggered by IP command (triggered by setting register bit IPCMD.TRG).

Enum.name: ARBCMDSRC_3
Enum.description: Triggered by suspended command (resumed).

BitField.name: AHBCMDERRID
BitField.description: Indicates the sequence index when an AHB command error is detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[AHBCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

BitField.name: AHBCMDERRCODE
BitField.description: Indicates the Error Code when AHB command Error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[AHBCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_0
Enum.description: No error.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_2
Enum.description: AHB Write command with JMP_ON_CS instruction used in the sequence.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_3
Enum.description: There is unknown instruction opcode in the sequence.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_4
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_RWDS_SDR used in DDR sequence.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_5
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_DDR/DUMMY_RWDS_DDR used in SDR sequence.

Enum.name: AHBCMDERRCODE_14
Enum.description: Sequence execution timeout.

BitField.name: IPCMDERRID
BitField.description: Indicates the sequence Index when IP command error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[IPCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

BitField.name: IPCMDERRCODE
BitField.description: Indicates the Error Code when IP command Error detected. This field will be cleared when INTR[IPCMDERR] is write-1-clear(w1c).

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_0
Enum.description: No error.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_2
Enum.description: IP command with JMP_ON_CS instruction used in the sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_3
Enum.description: There is unknown instruction opcode in the sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_4
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_SDR/DUMMY_RWDS_SDR used in DDR sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_5
Enum.description: Instruction DUMMY_DDR/DUMMY_RWDS_DDR used in SDR sequence.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_6
Enum.description: Flash access start address exceed the whole flash address range (A1/A2/B1/B2).

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_14
Enum.description: Sequence execution timeout.

Enum.name: IPCMDERRCODE_15
Enum.description: Flash boundary crossed.

BitField.name: ASLVLOCK
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock slave delay line locked.

BitField.name: AREFLOCK
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock reference delay line locked.

BitField.name: ASLVSEL
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock slave delay line delay cell number selection .

BitField.name: AREFSEL
BitField.description: Flash A sample clock reference delay line delay cell number selection.

BitField.name: BSLVLOCK
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock slave delay line locked.

BitField.name: BREFLOCK
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock reference delay line locked.

BitField.name: BSLVSEL
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock slave delay line delay cell number selection.

BitField.name: BREFSEL
BitField.description: Flash B sample clock reference delay line delay cell number selection.

BitField.name: ACTIVE
BitField.description: Indicates if an AHB read prefetch command sequence has been suspended.

BitField.name: BUFID
BitField.description: AHB RX BUF ID for suspended command sequence.

BitField.name: DATLFT
BitField.description: Left Data size for suspended command sequence (in byte).

BitField.name: FILL
BitField.description: Fill level of IP RX FIFO.

BitField.name: RDCNTR
BitField.description: Total Read Data Counter: RDCNTR * 64 Bits.

BitField.name: FILL
BitField.description: Fill level of IP TX FIFO.

BitField.name: WRCNTR
BitField.description: Total Write Data Counter: WRCNTR * 64 Bits.

Enum.name: IRQE_0
Enum.description: SR[KBERR] = 1 does not generate an interrupt request.

Enum.name: IRQE_1
Enum.description: SR[KBERR] = 1 generates an interrupt request.

Enum.name: FERR_0
Enum.description: No effect on the SR[KBERE] indicator.

Enum.name: FERR_1
Enum.description: SR[KBERR] is immediately set after a write with this data bit set.

Enum.name: FSVM_0
Enum.description: No effect on the operating mode.

Enum.name: FSVM_1
Enum.description: Force entry into SVM after a write with this data bit set and the data bit associated with FLDM cleared. SR[MODE] signals the operating mode.

Enum.name: FLDM_0
Enum.description: No effect on the operating mode.

Enum.name: FLDM_1
Enum.description: Force entry into LDM after a write with this data bit set. SR[MODE] signals the operating mode.

Enum.name: KBSE_0
Enum.description: Key blob KEK scrambling is disabled.

Enum.name: KBSE_1
Enum.description: Key blob KEK scrambling is enabled.

Enum.name: KBPE_0
Enum.description: Key blob processing is disabled.

Enum.name: KBPE_1
Enum.description: Key blob processing is enabled.

Enum.name: KBCE_0
Enum.description: CRC-32 during key blob processing is disabled.

Enum.name: KBCE_1
Enum.description: CRC-32 during key blob processing is enabled.

Enum.name: RRAE_0
Enum.description: Register access is fully enabled. The OTFAD programming model registers can be accessed "normally".

Enum.name: RRAE_1
Enum.description: Register access is restricted and only the CR, SR and optional MDPC registers can be accessed; others are treated as RAZ/WI.

Enum.name: SKBP_0
Enum.description: Key blob processing is not initiated.

Enum.name: SKBP_1
Enum.description: Properly-enabled key blob processing is initiated.

Enum.name: GE_0
Enum.description: OTFAD has decryption disabled. All data fetched by the FlexSPI bypasses OTFAD processing.

Enum.name: GE_1
Enum.description: OTFAD has decryption enabled, and processes data fetched by the FlexSPI as defined by the hardware configuration.

Enum.name: KBERR_0
Enum.description: No key blob error detected.

Enum.name: KBERR_1
Enum.description: One or more key blob errors has been detected.

Enum.name: MODE_0
Enum.description: Operating in Normal mode (NRM)

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: Unused (reserved)

Enum.name: MODE_2
Enum.description: Operating in Security Violation Mode (SVM)

Enum.name: MODE_3
Enum.description: Operating in Logically Disabled Mode (LDM)

Enum.name: NOERROR
Enum.description: No key blob error was detected for context "n".

Enum.name: ERROR
Enum.description: Either a key blob integrity error or a key blob CRC error was detected in context "n".

Enum.name: NOERROR
Enum.description: No key blob error was detected for context "n".

Enum.description: Either a key blob integrity error or a key blob CRC error was detected in context "n".

Enum.description: OTFAD is enabled, and processes data fetched by the FlexSPI as defined by the hardware configuration.

Enum.name: KBPE_1
Enum.description: Key blob processing is enabled.

Enum.name: KBD_0
Enum.description: Key blob processing was not enabled, or is not complete.

Enum.name: KBD_1
Enum.description: Key blob processing was enabled and is complete.

Enum.description: AHB clock is running (enabled) when CM7 is sleeping and TCM is accessible.

BitField.name: AXBS_P_M0_HIGH_PRIORITY
BitField.description: AXBS_P M0 master has higher priority.Do not set both M1 and M0 to high priority.

Enum.name: AXBS_P_M0_HIGH_PRIORITY_0
Enum.description: AXBS_P M0 master doesn't have high priority

Enum.name: AXBS_P_M0_HIGH_PRIORITY_1
Enum.description: AXBS_P M0 master has high priority

BitField.name: AXBS_P_M1_HIGH_PRIORITY
BitField.description: AXBS_P M1 master has higher priority.Do not set both M1 and M0 to high priority.

Enum.name: AXBS_P_M1_HIGH_PRIORITY_0
Enum.description: AXBS_P M1 master does not have high priority

Enum.name: AXBS_P_M1_HIGH_PRIORITY_1
Enum.description: AXBS_P M1 master has high priority

BitField.name: AXBS_P_FORCE_ROUND_ROBIN
BitField.description: Force Round Robin in AXBS_P. This bit can override master M0 M1 high priority configuration.

Enum.name: AXBS_P_FORCE_ROUND_ROBIN_0
Enum.description: AXBS_P masters are not arbitored in round robin, depending on M0/M1 master priority settings.

Enum.name: AXBS_P_FORCE_ROUND_ROBIN_1
Enum.description: AXBS_P masters are arbitored in round robin

BitField.name: L2_MEM_EN_POWERSAVING
BitField.description: Enable power saving features on L2 memory

Enum.name: L2_MEM_EN_POWERSAVING_0
Enum.description: Enters power saving mode only when chip is in SUSPEND mode

Enum.name: L2_MEM_EN_POWERSAVING_1
Enum.description: Controlled by L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP bitfield

BitField.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN
BitField.description: Automatically gate off RAM clock when RAM is not accessed.

Enum.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN_0
Enum.description: disable automatically gate off RAM clock

Enum.name: RAM_AUTO_CLK_GATING_EN_1
Enum.description: enable automatically gate off RAM clock

BitField.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP
BitField.description: This bit controls how memory (OCRAM) enters Deep Sleep mode (shutdown periphery power, but maintain memory contents, outputs of memory are pulled low

Enum.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP_0
Enum.description: No force sleep control supported, memory deep sleep mode only entered when whole system in stop mode (OCRAM in normal mode)

Enum.name: L2_MEM_DEEPSLEEP_1
Enum.description: Force memory into deep sleep mode (OCRAM in power saving mode)

BitField.name: MQS_CLK_DIV
BitField.description: Divider ratio control for mclk from hmclk

Enum.name: MQS_CLK_DIV_0
Enum.description: mclk frequency = hmclk frequency

Enum.name: MQS_CLK_DIV_1
Enum.description: mclk frequency = 1/2 * hmclk frequency

Enum.name: MQS_CLK_DIV_2
Enum.description: mclk frequency = 1/3 * hmclk frequency

Enum.name: MQS_CLK_DIV_255
Enum.description: mclk frequency = 1/256 * hmclk frequency

Enum.name: MQS_SW_RST_0
Enum.description: Exit software reset for MQS

Enum.name: MQS_SW_RST_1
Enum.description: Enable software reset for MQS

Enum.name: MQS_EN_0
Enum.description: Disable MQS

Enum.name: MQS_EN_1
Enum.description: Enable MQS

BitField.name: DCP_KEY_SEL
BitField.description: Select 128-bit DCP key from 256-bit key from SNVS Master Key

Enum.name: DCP_KEY_SEL_0
Enum.description: Select [127:0] from SNVS Master Key as DCP key

Enum.name: DCP_KEY_SEL_1
Enum.description: Select [255:128] from SNVS Master Key as DCP key

Enum.description: TCM write wait mode: Write RAM accesses are expected to be finished in 2-cycles.

Enum.name: TCM_RWAIT_EN_0

Enum.name: TCM_RWAIT_EN_1

Enum.name: PDE_0
Enum.description: Power Down Counter of WDOG is disabled.

Enum.name: PDE_1
Enum.description: Power Down Counter of WDOG is enabled (Default).

Enum.name: STOP_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: DBG_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: DBG_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: TST_0
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode disabled.

Enum.name: TST_1
Enum.description: Watchdog user mode enabled. (Watchdog test mode disabled.) After testing the watchdog, software should use this setting to indicate that the watchdog is functioning normally in user mode.

Enum.name: TST_2
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the low byte is used. CNT[CNTLOW] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALLOW].

Enum.name: TST_3
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the high byte is used. CNT[CNTHIGH] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALHIGH].

Enum.name: UPDATE_0
Enum.description: Updates not allowed. After the initial configuration, the watchdog cannot be later modified without forcing a reset.

Enum.name: UPDATE_1
Enum.description: Updates allowed. Software can modify the watchdog configuration registers within 128 bus clocks after performing the unlock write sequence.

Enum.name: INT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are disabled. Watchdog resets are not delayed.

Enum.name: INT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are enabled. Watchdog resets are delayed by 128 bus clocks from the interrupt vector fetch.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled.

Enum.name: CLK_0
Enum.description: Bus clock

Enum.name: CLK_1
Enum.description: LPO clock

Enum.name: CLK_2
Enum.description: INTCLK (internal clock)

Enum.name: CLK_3
Enum.description: ERCLK (external reference clock)

Enum.name: RCS_0
Enum.description: Reconfiguring WDOG.

Enum.name: RCS_1
Enum.description: Reconfiguration is successful.

Enum.name: ULK_0
Enum.description: WDOG is locked.

Enum.name: ULK_1
Enum.description: WDOG is unlocked.

Enum.name: PRES_0
Enum.description: 256 prescaler disabled.

Enum.name: PRES_1
Enum.description: 256 prescaler enabled.

BitField.name: CMD32EN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (otherwise 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

Enum.name: CMD32EN_0
Enum.description: Disables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. Only 16-bit or 8-bit is supported.

Enum.name: CMD32EN_1
Enum.description: Enables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. 16-bit or 8-bit is NOT supported.

Enum.name: FLG_0
Enum.description: No interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: FLG_1
Enum.description: An interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: WIN_0
Enum.description: Window mode disabled.

Enum.name: WIN_1
Enum.description: Window mode enabled.

BitField.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: TOVALLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the timeout value

BitField.name: TOVALHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the timeout value

Enum.name: MODE_0

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: 10-bit conversion

Enum.name: MODE_2
Enum.description: 12-bit conversion

Enum.description: Short sample mode.

Enum.name: ADLSMP_1
Enum.description: Long sample mode.

Enum.name: ADIV_0
Enum.description: Input clock

Enum.name: ADIV_1
Enum.description: Input clock / 2

Enum.name: ADIV_2
Enum.description: Input clock / 4

Enum.name: ADIV_3
Enum.description: Input clock / 8

Enum.name: ADLPC_0
Enum.description: ADC hard block not in low power mode.

Enum.name: ADLPC_1
Enum.description: ADC hard block in low power mode.

Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 2 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 12 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: ADSTS_1
Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 4 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 16 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: ADSTS_2
Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 6 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 20 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: ADSTS_3
Enum.description: Sample period (ADC clocks) = 8 if ADLSMP=0b Sample period (ADC clocks) = 24 if ADLSMP=1b

Enum.name: ADHSC_0
Enum.description: Normal conversion selected.

Enum.name: ADHSC_1
Enum.description: High speed conversion selected.

Enum.name: REFSEL_0
Enum.description: Selects VREFH/VREFL as reference voltage.

Enum.name: ADTRG_0
Enum.description: Software trigger selected

Enum.name: ADTRG_1
Enum.description: Hardware trigger selected

Enum.name: AVGS_0
Enum.description: 4 samples averaged

Enum.name: AVGS_1
Enum.description: 8 samples averaged

Enum.name: AVGS_2
Enum.description: 16 samples averaged

Enum.name: AVGS_3
Enum.description: 32 samples averaged

Enum.name: OVWREN_0
Enum.description: Disable the overwriting. Existing Data in Data result register will not be overwritten by subsequent converted data.

Enum.name: OVWREN_1
Enum.description: Enable the overwriting.

Enum.name: ADACKEN_0
Enum.description: Asynchronous clock output disabled; Asynchronous clock only enabled if selected by ADICLK and a conversion is active.

Enum.name: ADACKEN_1
Enum.description: Asynchronous clock and clock output enabled regardless of the state of the ADC

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: DMA disabled (default)

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA enabled

Enum.name: ACREN_0
Enum.description: Range function disabled. Only the compare value 1 of ADC_CV register (CV1) is compared.

Enum.name: ACREN_1
Enum.description: Range function enabled. Both compare values of ADC_CV registers (CV1 and CV2) are compared.

Enum.name: ACFGT_0
Enum.description: Configures "Less Than Threshold, Outside Range Not Inclusive and Inside Range Not Inclusive" functionality based on the values placed in the ADC_CV register.

Enum.name: ACFGT_1
Enum.description: Configures "Greater Than Or Equal To Threshold, Outside Range Inclusive and Inside Range Inclusive" functionality based on the values placed in the ADC_CV registers.

Enum.name: ACFE_0
Enum.description: Compare function disabled

Enum.name: ACFE_1
Enum.description: Compare function enabled

Enum.name: AVGE_0
Enum.description: Hardware average function disabled

Enum.name: AVGE_1
Enum.description: Hardware average function enabled

Enum.name: ADCO_0
Enum.description: One conversion or one set of conversions if the hardware average function is enabled (AVGE=1) after initiating a conversion.

Enum.name: ADCO_1
Enum.description: Continuous conversions or sets of conversions if the hardware average function is enabled (AVGE=1) after initiating a conversion.

Enum.name: ADACT_0
Enum.description: Conversion not in progress.

Enum.name: ADACT_1
Enum.description: Conversion in progress.

Enum.name: CALF_0
Enum.description: Calibration completed normally.

Enum.name: CALF_1
Enum.description: Calibration failed. ADC accuracy specifications are not guaranteed.

Enum.name: AWKST_0
Enum.description: No asynchronous interrupt.

Enum.name: AWKST_1
Enum.description: Asynchronous wake up interrupt occurred in stop mode.

Enum.name: SIGN_0
Enum.description: The offset value is added with the raw result

Enum.name: SIGN_1
Enum.description: The offset value is subtracted from the raw converted value

Enum.name: SAMP_MODE_0
Enum.description: use Von Neumann data into both Entropy shifter and Statistical Checker

Enum.name: SAMP_MODE_1
Enum.description: use raw data into both Entropy shifter and Statistical Checker

Enum.name: SAMP_MODE_2
Enum.description: use Von Neumann data into Entropy shifter. Use raw data into Statistical Checker

Enum.name: OSC_DIV_0
Enum.description: use ring oscillator with no divide

Enum.name: OSC_DIV_1
Enum.description: use ring oscillator divided-by-2

Enum.name: OSC_DIV_2
Enum.description: use ring oscillator divided-by-4

Enum.name: OSC_DIV_3
Enum.description: use ring oscillator divided-by-8

BitField.name: TF1BR1
BitField.description: Test Fail, 1-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF1BR1=1, the 1-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF2BR0
BitField.description: Test Fail, 2-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF2BR0=1, the 2-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF2BR1
BitField.description: Test Fail, 2-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF2BR1=1, the 2-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF3BR0
BitField.description: Test Fail, 3-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF3BR0=1, the 3-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF3BR1
BitField.description: Test Fail, 3-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF3BR1=1, the 3-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF4BR0
BitField.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF4BR0=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF4BR1
BitField.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF4BR1=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF5BR0

BitField.name: TF5BR1
BitField.description: Test Fail, 5-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF5BR1=1, the 5-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF6PBR0

BitField.name: TF6PBR1

BitField.description: Test Fail, Sparse Bit. If TFSB=1, the Sparse Bit Test has failed.

BitField.name: TFLR

BitField.name: TFP

BitField.name: TFMB

Enum.name: ENT_VAL_0
Enum.description: Busy generation entropy. Any value read is invalid.

Enum.name: ENT_VAL_1
Enum.description: TRNG can be stopped and entropy is valid if read.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_0
Enum.description: No hardware nor self test frequency errors.

Enum.name: FRQ_CT_FAIL_1
Enum.description: The frequency counter has detected a failure.

BitField.name: MIN_REV
BitField.description: Shows the IP's Minor revision of the TRNG.

Enum.name: MIN_REV_0
Enum.description: Minor revision number for TRNG.

BitField.name: MAJ_REV
BitField.description: Shows the IP's Major revision of the TRNG.

Enum.name: MAJ_REV_1
Enum.description: Major revision number for TRNG.

Enum.name: IP_ID_48
Enum.description: ID for TRNG.

BitField.name: CONFIG_OPT
BitField.description: Shows the IP's Configuaration options for the TRNG.

Enum.name: CONFIG_OPT_0
Enum.description: TRNG_CONFIG_OPT for TRNG.

BitField.name: ECO_REV
BitField.description: Shows the IP's ECO revision of the TRNG.

Enum.name: ECO_REV_0
Enum.description: TRNG_ECO_REV for TRNG.

BitField.name: INTG_OPT
BitField.description: Shows the integration options for the TRNG.

Enum.name: INTG_OPT_0
Enum.description: INTG_OPT for TRNG.

BitField.name: ERA
BitField.description: Shows the compile options for the TRNG.

Enum.name: ERA_0
Enum.description: COMPILE_OPT for TRNG.

BitField.name: ZMK_WSL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and the ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

Enum.name: ZMK_WSL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: ZMK_WSL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: ZMK_RSL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Soft Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK Registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

Enum.name: ZMK_RSL_0
Enum.description: Read access is allowed (only in software Programming mode)

Enum.name: ZMK_RSL_1
Enum.description: Read access is not allowed

BitField.name: SRTC_SL
BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC Registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

Enum.name: SRTC_SL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: SRTC_SL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: LPCALB_SL
BitField.description: LP Calibration Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

Enum.name: LPCALB_SL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: LPCALB_SL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: MC_SL
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

Enum.name: MC_SL_0
Enum.description: Write access (increment) is allowed

Enum.name: MC_SL_1
Enum.description: Write access (increment) is not allowed

BitField.name: GPR_SL
BitField.description: General Purpose Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

Enum.name: GPR_SL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: GPR_SL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: LPSVCR_SL
BitField.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

Enum.name: LPSVCR_SL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: LPSVCR_SL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: LPTDCR_SL
BitField.description: LP Tamper Detectors Configuration Register Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPTDCR

Enum.name: LPTDCR_SL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: LPTDCR_SL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: MKS_SL
BitField.description: Master Key Select Soft Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LPMKCR

Enum.name: MKS_SL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: MKS_SL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: HPSVCR_L
BitField.description: HP Security Violation Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSVCR

Enum.name: HPSVCR_L_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: HPSVCR_L_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: HPSICR_L
BitField.description: HP Security Interrupt Control Register Lock When set, prevents any writes to the HPSICR

Enum.name: HPSICR_L_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: HPSICR_L_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: HAC_L
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Lock When set, prevents any writes to HPHACIVR, HPHACR, and HAC_EN bit of HPCOMR

Enum.name: HAC_L_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed

Enum.name: HAC_L_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed

BitField.name: SSM_ST
BitField.description: SSM State Transition Transition state of the system security monitor

BitField.name: SSM_ST_DIS
BitField.description: SSM Secure to Trusted State Transition Disable When set, disables the SSM transition from secure to trusted state

Enum.name: SSM_ST_DIS_0
Enum.description: Secure to Trusted State transition is enabled

Enum.name: SSM_ST_DIS_1
Enum.description: Secure to Trusted State transition is disabled

BitField.name: SSM_SFNS_DIS
BitField.description: SSM Soft Fail to Non-Secure State Transition Disable When set, it disables the SSM transition from soft fail to non-secure state

Enum.name: SSM_SFNS_DIS_0
Enum.description: Soft Fail to Non-Secure State transition is enabled

Enum.name: SSM_SFNS_DIS_1
Enum.description: Soft Fail to Non-Secure State transition is disabled

BitField.name: LP_SWR
BitField.description: LP Software Reset When set to 1, most registers in the SNVS_LP section are reset, but the following registers are not reset by an LP software reset: Secure Real Time Counter Time Alarm Register This bit cannot be set when the LP_SWR_DIS bit is set

Enum.name: LP_SWR_0
Enum.description: No Action

Enum.name: LP_SWR_1
Enum.description: Reset LP section

BitField.name: LP_SWR_DIS
BitField.description: LP Software Reset Disable When set, disables the LP software reset

Enum.name: LP_SWR_DIS_0
Enum.description: LP software reset is enabled

Enum.name: LP_SWR_DIS_1
Enum.description: LP software reset is disabled

BitField.name: SW_SV
BitField.description: Software Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a non-fatal security violation

BitField.name: SW_FSV
BitField.description: Software Fatal Security Violation When set, the system security monitor treats this bit as a fatal security violation

BitField.name: SW_LPSV
BitField.description: LP Software Security Violation When set, SNVS_LP treats this bit as a security violation

BitField.name: PROG_ZMK
BitField.description: Program Zeroizable Master Key This bit activates ZMK hardware programming mechanism

Enum.name: PROG_ZMK_0
Enum.description: No Action

Enum.name: PROG_ZMK_1
Enum.description: Activate hardware key programming mechanism

BitField.name: MKS_EN
BitField.description: Master Key Select Enable When not set, the one time programmable (OTP) master key is selected by default

Enum.name: MKS_EN_0
Enum.description: OTP master key is selected as an SNVS master key

Enum.name: MKS_EN_1
Enum.description: SNVS master key is selected according to the setting of the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of LPMKCR

BitField.name: HAC_EN
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Enable This bit controls the SSM transition from the soft fail to the hard fail state

Enum.name: HAC_EN_0
Enum.description: High Assurance Counter is disabled

Enum.name: HAC_EN_1
Enum.description: High Assurance Counter is enabled

BitField.name: HAC_LOAD
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Load When set, it loads the High Assurance Counter Register with the value of the High Assurance Counter Load Register

Enum.name: HAC_LOAD_0
Enum.description: No Action

Enum.name: HAC_LOAD_1
Enum.description: Load the HAC

BitField.name: HAC_CLEAR
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Clear When set, it clears the High Assurance Counter Register

Enum.name: HAC_CLEAR_0
Enum.description: No Action

Enum.name: HAC_CLEAR_1
Enum.description: Clear the HAC

BitField.name: HAC_STOP
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Stop This bit can be set only when SSM is in soft fail state

BitField.name: NPSWA_EN
BitField.description: Non-Privileged Software Access Enable When set, allows non-privileged software to access all SNVS registers, including those that are privileged software read/write access only

Enum.name: RTC_EN_0
Enum.description: RTC is disabled

Enum.name: RTC_EN_1
Enum.description: RTC is enabled

BitField.name: HPTA_EN
BitField.description: HP Time Alarm Enable When set, the time alarm interrupt is generated if the value in the HP Time Alarm Registers is equal to the value of the HP Real Time Counter

Enum.name: HPTA_EN_0
Enum.description: HP Time Alarm Interrupt is disabled

Enum.name: HPTA_EN_1
Enum.description: HP Time Alarm Interrupt is enabled

BitField.name: DIS_PI
BitField.description: Disable periodic interrupt in the functional interrupt

Enum.name: DIS_PI_0
Enum.description: Periodic interrupt will trigger a functional interrupt

Enum.name: DIS_PI_1
Enum.description: Disable periodic interrupt in the function interrupt

BitField.name: PI_EN
BitField.description: HP Periodic Interrupt Enable The periodic interrupt can be generated only if the HP Real Time Counter is enabled

Enum.name: PI_EN_0
Enum.description: HP Periodic Interrupt is disabled

Enum.name: PI_EN_1
Enum.description: HP Periodic Interrupt is enabled

BitField.name: PI_FREQ
BitField.description: Periodic Interrupt Frequency Defines frequency of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_0
Enum.description: - bit 0 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_1
Enum.description: - bit 1 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_2
Enum.description: - bit 2 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_3
Enum.description: - bit 3 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_4
Enum.description: - bit 4 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_5
Enum.description: - bit 5 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_6
Enum.description: - bit 6 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_7
Enum.description: - bit 7 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_8
Enum.description: - bit 8 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_9
Enum.description: - bit 9 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_10
Enum.description: - bit 10 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_11
Enum.description: - bit 11 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_12
Enum.description: - bit 12 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_13
Enum.description: - bit 13 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_14
Enum.description: - bit 14 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

Enum.name: PI_FREQ_15
Enum.description: - bit 15 of the HPRTCLR is selected as a source of the periodic interrupt

BitField.name: HPCALB_EN
BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter Calibration Enabled Indicates that the time calibration mechanism is enabled.

Enum.name: HPCALB_EN_0
Enum.description: HP Timer calibration disabled

Enum.name: HPCALB_EN_1
Enum.description: HP Timer calibration enabled

BitField.name: HPCALB_VAL
BitField.description: HP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for the HP Real Time Counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_0
Enum.description: +0 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_1
Enum.description: +1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_2
Enum.description: +2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_15
Enum.description: +15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_16
Enum.description: -16 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_17
Enum.description: -15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_30
Enum.description: -2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HPCALB_VAL_31
Enum.description: -1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter

Enum.name: HP_TS_0
Enum.description: No Action

Enum.name: HP_TS_1
Enum.description: Synchronize the HP Time Counter to the LP Time Counter

Enum.description: Security Violation 0 Interrupt is Disabled

Enum.name: SV0_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 Interrupt is Enabled

Enum.description: Security Violation 1 Interrupt is Disabled

Enum.name: SV1_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 Interrupt is Enabled

Enum.name: SV2_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 Interrupt is Disabled

Enum.name: SV2_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 Interrupt is Enabled

BitField.description: Security Violation 3 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 3 security violation

Enum.name: SV3_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 Interrupt is Disabled

Enum.name: SV3_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 Interrupt is Enabled

BitField.description: Security Violation 4 Interrupt Enable Setting this bit to 1 enables generation of the security interrupt to the host processor upon detection of the Security Violation 4 security violation

Enum.name: SV4_EN_0

Enum.name: SV5_EN_0

Enum.name: SV5_EN_1

Enum.name: LPSVI_EN_0
Enum.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt is Disabled

Enum.name: LPSVI_EN_1
Enum.description: LP Security Violation Interrupt is Enabled

Enum.name: SV0_CFG_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: SV0_CFG_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is a fatal violation

Enum.name: SV1_CFG_0

Enum.name: SV1_CFG_1

BitField.name: SV2_CFG

Enum.name: SV2_CFG_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: SV2_CFG_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: SV3_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 3 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 3 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: SV3_CFG_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: SV3_CFG_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is a fatal violation

BitField.name: SV4_CFG
BitField.description: Security Violation 4 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 4 Security Violation Input

Enum.name: SV4_CFG_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: SV4_CFG_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is a fatal violation

BitField.description: Security Violation 5 Security Violation Configuration This field configures the Security Violation 5 Security Violation Input

Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is a non-fatal violation

BitField.description: LP Security Violation Configuration This field configures the LP security violation source.

Enum.name: LPSV_CFG_1
Enum.description: LP security violation is a non-fatal violation

Enum.name: LPSV_CFG_2

BitField.name: HPTA
BitField.description: HP Time Alarm Indicates that the HP Time Alarm has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

Enum.name: HPTA_0
Enum.description: No time alarm interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: HPTA_1
Enum.description: A time alarm interrupt occurred.

BitField.name: PI
BitField.description: Periodic Interrupt Indicates that periodic interrupt has occurred since this bit was last cleared.

Enum.name: PI_0
Enum.description: No periodic interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: PI_1
Enum.description: A periodic interrupt occurred.

BitField.name: LPDIS
BitField.description: Low Power Disable If 1, the low power section has been disabled by means of an input signal to SNVS

BitField.name: BTN
BitField.description: Button Value of the BTN input

BitField.name: BI
BitField.description: Button Interrupt Signal ipi_snvs_btn_int_b was asserted.

BitField.name: SSM_STATE
BitField.description: System Security Monitor State This field contains the encoded state of the SSM's state machine

Enum.name: SSM_STATE_1
Enum.description: Hard Fail

Enum.name: SSM_STATE_3
Enum.description: Soft Fail

Enum.name: SSM_STATE_8
Enum.description: Init Intermediate (transition state between Init and Check - SSM stays in this state only one clock cycle)

BitField.name: SECURITY_CONFIG
BitField.description: Security Configuration This field reflects the settings of the sys_secure_boot input and the three security configuration inputs to SNVS

Enum.name: FAB_CONFIG
Enum.description: FAB configuration

Enum.name: OPEN_CONFIG
Enum.description: OPEN configuration

Enum.name: OPEN_CONFIG
Enum.description: OPEN configuration

Enum.name: OPEN_CONFIG
Enum.description: OPEN configuration

Enum.name: FIELD_RETURN_CONFIG
Enum.description: FIELD RETURN configuration

Enum.name: FAB_CONFIG
Enum.description: FAB configuration

Enum.name: CLOSED_CONFIG
Enum.description: CLOSED configuration

Enum.name: CLOSED_CONFIG
Enum.description: CLOSED configuration

Enum.name: CLOSED_CONFIG
Enum.description: CLOSED configuration

BitField.name: OTPMK_SYNDROME
BitField.description: One Time Programmable Master Key Syndrome In the case of a single-bit error, the eight lower bits of this value indicate the bit number of error location

BitField.name: OTPMK_ZERO
BitField.description: One Time Programmable Master Key is Equal to Zero

Enum.name: OTPMK_ZERO_0
Enum.description: The OTPMK is not zero.

Enum.name: OTPMK_ZERO_1
Enum.description: The OTPMK is zero.

BitField.name: ZMK_ZERO
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key is Equal to Zero

Enum.name: ZMK_ZERO_0
Enum.description: The ZMK is not zero.

Enum.name: ZMK_ZERO_1
Enum.description: The ZMK is zero.

BitField.description: Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: SV0_0
Enum.description: No Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: SV0_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: SV1_0

Enum.name: SV2_0
Enum.description: No Security Violation 2 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV3
BitField.description: Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: SV3_0
Enum.description: No Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: SV3_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV4
BitField.description: Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

Enum.name: SV4_0
Enum.description: No Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

Enum.description: Security Violation 4 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SV5
BitField.description: Security Violation 5 security violation was detected.

BitField.name: SW_SV
BitField.description: Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_SV bit in the HP Command Register

BitField.name: SW_FSV
BitField.description: Software Fatal Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_FSV bit in the HP Command Register

BitField.name: SW_LPSV
BitField.description: LP Software Security Violation This bit is a read-only copy of the SW_LPSV bit in the HP Command Register

BitField.name: ZMK_SYNDROME
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Syndrome The ZMK syndrome indicates the single-bit error location and parity for the ZMK register

BitField.name: ZMK_ECC_FAIL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Failure When set, this bit triggers a bad key violation to the SSM and a security violation to the SNVS_LP section, which clears security sensitive data

Enum.name: ZMK_ECC_FAIL_0
Enum.description: ZMK ECC Failure was not detected.

Enum.name: ZMK_ECC_FAIL_1
Enum.description: ZMK ECC Failure was detected.

BitField.name: LP_SEC_VIO
BitField.description: LP Security Violation A security volation was detected in the SNVS low power section.

Register.name: HPHACIVR
Register.description: SNVS_HP High Assurance Counter IV Register

BitField.name: HAC_COUNTER_IV
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter Initial Value This register is used to set the starting count value to the high assurance counter

BitField.name: HAC_COUNTER
BitField.description: High Assurance Counter When the HAC_EN bit is set and the SSM is in the soft fail state, this counter starts to count down with the system clock

Register.name: HPRTCMR
Register.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter MSB Register

BitField.name: RTC
BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the RTC

Register.name: HPRTCLR
Register.description: SNVS_HP Real Time Counter LSB Register

BitField.name: RTC
BitField.description: HP Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits

BitField.name: ZMK_WHL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Write Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (software and hardware) to the ZMK registers and ZMK_HWP, ZMK_VAL, and ZMK_ECC_EN fields of the LPMKCR

Enum.name: ZMK_WHL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed.

Enum.name: ZMK_WHL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed.

BitField.name: ZMK_RHL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Read Hard Lock When set, prevents any software reads to the ZMK registers and ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of the LPMKCR

Enum.name: ZMK_RHL_0
Enum.description: Read access is allowed (only in software programming mode).

Enum.name: ZMK_RHL_1
Enum.description: Read access is not allowed.

BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the SRTC registers, SRTC_ENV, and SRTC_INV_EN bits

Enum.name: SRTC_HL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed.

Enum.name: SRTC_HL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed.

BitField.name: LPCALB_HL
BitField.description: LP Calibration Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LP Calibration Value (LPCALB_VAL) and LP Calibration Enable (LPCALB_EN)

Enum.name: LPCALB_HL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed.

Enum.name: LPCALB_HL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed.

BitField.name: MC_HL
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes (increments) to the MC Registers and MC_ENV bit

Enum.name: MC_HL_0
Enum.description: Write access (increment) is allowed.

Enum.name: MC_HL_1
Enum.description: Write access (increment) is not allowed.

BitField.name: GPR_HL
BitField.description: General Purpose Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the GPR

Enum.name: GPR_HL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed.

Enum.name: GPR_HL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed.

BitField.name: LPSVCR_HL
BitField.description: LP Security Violation Control Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPSVCR

Enum.name: LPSVCR_HL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed.

Enum.name: LPSVCR_HL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed.

BitField.name: LPTDCR_HL
BitField.description: LP Tamper Detectors Configuration Register Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the LPTDCR

Enum.name: LPTDCR_HL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed.

Enum.name: LPTDCR_HL_1
Enum.description: Write access is not allowed.

BitField.name: MKS_HL
BitField.description: Master Key Select Hard Lock When set, prevents any writes to the MASTER_KEY_SEL field of the LP Master Key Control Register

Enum.name: MKS_HL_0
Enum.description: Write access is allowed.

Enum.name: MKS_HL_1
