BitField.description: Secure Real Time Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the SRTC becomes operational

Enum.name: SRTC_ENV_0
Enum.description: SRTC is disabled or invalid.

Enum.name: SRTC_ENV_1
Enum.description: SRTC is enabled and valid.

BitField.name: LPTA_EN
BitField.description: LP Time Alarm Enable When set, the SNVS functional interrupt is asserted if the LP Time Alarm Register is equal to the 32 MSBs of the secure real time counter

Enum.name: LPTA_EN_0
Enum.description: LP time alarm interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: LPTA_EN_1
Enum.description: LP time alarm interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: MC_ENV
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Enabled and Valid When set, the MC can be incremented (by write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR)

Enum.name: MC_ENV_0
Enum.description: MC is disabled or invalid.

Enum.name: MC_ENV_1
Enum.description: MC is enabled and valid.

BitField.name: LPWUI_EN
BitField.description: LP Wake-Up Interrupt Enable This interrupt line should be connected to the external pin and is intended to inform the external chip about an SNVS_LP event (tamper event, MC rollover, SRTC rollover, or time alarm )

BitField.name: SRTC_INV_EN
BitField.description: If this bit is 1, in the case of a security violation the SRTC stops counting and the SRTC is invalidated (SRTC_ENV bit is cleared)

Enum.name: SRTC_INV_EN_0
Enum.description: SRTC stays valid in the case of security violation.

Enum.name: SRTC_INV_EN_1
Enum.description: SRTC is invalidated in the case of security violation.

BitField.name: DP_EN
BitField.description: Dumb PMIC Enabled When set, software can control the system power

Enum.name: DP_EN_0
Enum.description: Smart PMIC enabled.

Enum.name: DP_EN_1
Enum.description: Dumb PMIC enabled.

BitField.name: TOP
BitField.description: Turn off System Power Asserting this bit causes a signal to be sent to the Power Management IC to turn off the system power

Enum.name: TOP_0
Enum.description: Leave system power on.

Enum.name: TOP_1
Enum.description: Turn off system power.

BitField.name: PWR_GLITCH_EN
BitField.description: Power Glitch Enable By default the detection of a power glitch does not cause the pmic_en_b signal to be asserted

BitField.name: LPCALB_EN
BitField.description: LP Calibration Enable When set, enables the SRTC calibration mechanism

Enum.name: LPCALB_EN_0
Enum.description: SRTC Time calibration is disabled.

Enum.name: LPCALB_EN_1
Enum.description: SRTC Time calibration is enabled.

BitField.name: LPCALB_VAL
BitField.description: LP Calibration Value Defines signed calibration value for SRTC

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_0
Enum.description: +0 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_1
Enum.description: +1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_2
Enum.description: +2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_15
Enum.description: +15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_16
Enum.description: -16 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_17
Enum.description: -15 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_30
Enum.description: -2 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

Enum.name: LPCALB_VAL_31
Enum.description: -1 counts per each 32768 ticks of the counter clock

BitField.name: BTN_PRESS_TIME
BitField.description: This field configures the button press time out values for the PMIC Logic

BitField.name: DEBOUNCE
BitField.description: This field configures the amount of debounce time for the BTN input signal

BitField.name: ON_TIME
BitField.description: The ON_TIME field is used to configure the period of time after BTN is asserted before pmic_en_b is asserted to turn on the SoC power

BitField.name: PK_EN
BitField.description: PMIC On Request Enable The value written to PK_EN will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_en

BitField.name: PK_OVERRIDE
BitField.description: PMIC On Request Override The value written to PK_OVERRIDE will be asserted on output signal snvs_lp_pk_override

BitField.name: MASTER_KEY_SEL
BitField.description: Master Key Select These bits select the SNVS Master Key output when Master Key Select bits are enabled by MKS_EN bit in the HPCOMR

Enum.name: MASTER_KEY_SEL_0
Enum.description: Select one time programmable master key.

Enum.name: MASTER_KEY_SEL_2
Enum.description: Select zeroizable master key when MKS_EN bit is set .

Enum.name: MASTER_KEY_SEL_3
Enum.description: Select combined master key when MKS_EN bit is set .

BitField.name: ZMK_HWP
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key hardware Programming mode When set, only the hardware key programming mechanism can set the ZMK and software cannot read it

Enum.name: ZMK_HWP_0
Enum.description: ZMK is in the software programming mode.

Enum.name: ZMK_HWP_1
Enum.description: ZMK is in the hardware programming mode.

BitField.name: ZMK_VAL
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Valid When set, the ZMK value can be selected by the master key control block for use by cryptographic modules

Enum.name: ZMK_VAL_0
Enum.description: ZMK is not valid.

Enum.name: ZMK_VAL_1
Enum.description: ZMK is valid.

BitField.name: ZMK_ECC_EN
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Check Enable Writing one to this field automatically calculates and sets the ZMK ECC value in the ZMK_ECC_VALUE field of this register

Enum.name: ZMK_ECC_EN_0
Enum.description: ZMK ECC check is disabled.

Enum.name: ZMK_ECC_EN_1
Enum.description: ZMK ECC check is enabled.

BitField.name: ZMK_ECC_VALUE
BitField.description: Zeroizable Master Key Error Correcting Code Value This field is automatically calculated and set when one is written into ZMK_ECC_EN bit of this register

BitField.name: SV0_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 0 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 0 Input

Enum.name: SV0_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: SV0_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 0 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV1_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 1 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 1 Input

Enum.name: SV1_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: SV1_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 1 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV2_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 2 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 2 Input

Enum.name: SV2_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: SV2_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 2 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV3_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 3 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 3 Input

Enum.name: SV3_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: SV3_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 3 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV4_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 4 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 4 Input

Enum.name: SV4_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: SV4_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 4 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SV5_EN
BitField.description: Security Violation 5 Enable This bit enables Security Violation 5 Input

Enum.name: SV5_EN_0
Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is disabled in the LP domain.

Enum.name: SV5_EN_1
Enum.description: Security Violation 5 is enabled in the LP domain.

BitField.name: SRTCR_EN
BitField.description: SRTC Rollover Enable When set, an SRTC rollover event generates an LP security violation.

Enum.name: SRTCR_EN_0
Enum.description: SRTC rollover is disabled.

Enum.name: SRTCR_EN_1
Enum.description: SRTC rollover is enabled.

BitField.name: MCR_EN
BitField.description: MC Rollover Enable When set, an MC Rollover event generates an LP security violation.

Enum.name: MCR_EN_0
Enum.description: MC rollover is disabled.

Enum.name: MCR_EN_1
Enum.description: MC rollover is enabled.

BitField.name: ET1_EN
BitField.description: External Tampering 1 Enable When set, external tampering 1 detection generates an LP security violation

Enum.name: ET1_EN_0
Enum.description: External tamper 1 is disabled.

Enum.name: ET1_EN_1
Enum.description: External tamper 1 is enabled.

BitField.name: ET1P
BitField.description: External Tampering 1 Polarity This bit is used to determine the polarity of external tamper 1.

Enum.name: ET1P_0
Enum.description: External tamper 1 is active low.

Enum.name: ET1P_1
Enum.description: External tamper 1 is active high.

BitField.name: PFD_OBSERV
BitField.description: System Power Fail Detector (PFD) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the inverted output of the PFD analog circuitry (external to the SNVS block)

BitField.name: POR_OBSERV
BitField.description: Power On Reset (POR) Observability Flop The asynchronous reset input of this flop is connected directly to the output of the POR analog circuitry (external to the SNVS

BitField.name: OSCB
BitField.description: Oscillator Bypass When OSCB=1 the osc_bypass signal is asserted

Enum.name: OSCB_0
Enum.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator not bypassed.

Enum.name: OSCB_1
Enum.description: Normal SRTC clock oscillator bypassed. Alternate clock can drive the SRTC clock source.

Enum.name: LPTA_0
Enum.description: No time alarm interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: LPTA_1
Enum.description: A time alarm interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: SRTCR_0
Enum.description: SRTC has not reached its maximum value.

Enum.name: SRTCR_1
Enum.description: SRTC has reached its maximum value.

Enum.name: MCR_0
Enum.description: MC has not reached its maximum value.

Enum.name: MCR_1
Enum.description: MC has reached its maximum value.

BitField.name: PGD
BitField.description: Power Supply Glitch Detected 0 No power supply glitch. 1 Power supply glitch is detected.

Enum.name: ET1D_0
Enum.description: External tampering 1 not detected.

Enum.name: ET1D_1
Enum.description: External tampering 1 detected.

BitField.name: ESVD
BitField.description: External Security Violation Detected Indicates that a security violation is detected on one of the HP security violation ports

Enum.name: ESVD_0
Enum.description: No external security violation.

Enum.name: ESVD_1
Enum.description: External security violation is detected.

BitField.name: EO
BitField.description: Emergency Off This bit is set when a power off is requested.

Enum.name: EO_0
Enum.description: Emergency off was not detected.

Enum.name: EO_1
Enum.description: Emergency off was detected.

BitField.name: SPO
BitField.description: Set Power Off The SPO bit is set when the power button is pressed longer than the configured debounce time

Enum.name: SPO_0
Enum.description: Set Power Off was not detected.

Enum.name: SPO_1
Enum.description: Set Power Off was detected.

Enum.name: SED_0
Enum.description: Scan exit was not detected.

Enum.name: SED_1
Enum.description: Scan exit was detected.

BitField.name: LPNS
BitField.description: LP Section is Non-Secured Indicates that LP section was provisioned/programmed in the non-secure state

Enum.name: LPNS_0
Enum.description: LP section was not programmed in the non-secure state.

Enum.name: LPNS_1
Enum.description: LP section was programmed in the non-secure state.

BitField.name: LPS
BitField.description: LP Section is Secured Indicates that the LP section is provisioned/programmed in the secure or trusted state

Enum.name: LPS_0
Enum.description: LP section was not programmed in secure or trusted state.

Enum.name: LPS_1
Enum.description: LP section was programmed in secure or trusted state.

Register.name: LPSRTCMR
Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter MSB Register

BitField.name: SRTC
BitField.description: LP Secure Real Time Counter The most-significant 15 bits of the SRTC

Register.name: LPSRTCLR
Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Real Time Counter LSB Register

BitField.name: SRTC
BitField.description: LP Secure Real Time Counter least-significant 32 bits This register can be programmed only when SRTC is not active and not locked, meaning the SRTC_ENV, SRTC_SL, and SRTC_HL bits are not set

BitField.name: LPTA
BitField.description: LP Time Alarm This register can be programmed only when the LP time alarm is disabled (LPTA_EN bit is not set)

Register.name: LPSMCMR
Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter MSB Register

BitField.name: MON_COUNTER
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter most-significant 16 Bits The MC is incremented by one when: A write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR register is detected

BitField.name: MC_ERA_BITS
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter Era Bits These bits are inputs to the module and typically connect to fuses

Register.name: LPSMCLR
Register.description: SNVS_LP Secure Monotonic Counter LSB Register

BitField.name: MON_COUNTER
BitField.description: Monotonic Counter bits The MC is incremented by one when: A write transaction to the LPSMCMR or LPSMCLR Register is detected

BitField.name: GPR
BitField.description: General Purpose Register When GPR_SL or GPR_HL bit is set, the register cannot be programmed.

BitField.description: IP Era 00h - Era 1 or 2 03h - Era 3 04h - Era 4 05h - Era 5

BitField.description: This field controls the PLL loop divider. 0 - Fout=Fref*20; 1 - Fout=Fref*22.

BitField.name: EN_USB_CLKS

Enum.description: PLL outputs for USBPHYn off.

Enum.name: EN_USB_CLKS_1
Enum.description: PLL outputs for USBPHYn on.

Register.name: CCM_ANALOG_PFD_480
Register.description: 480MHz Clock (PLL3) Phase Fractional Divider Control Register

BitField.name: PFD0_FRAC
BitField.description: This field controls the fractional divide value

BitField.name: PFD0_STABLE
BitField.description: This read-only bitfield is for DIAGNOSTIC PURPOSES ONLY since the fractional divider should become stable quickly enough that this field will never need to be used by either device driver or application code

BitField.name: PFD0_CLKGATE
BitField.description: If set to 1, the IO fractional divider clock (reference ref_pfd0) is off (power savings)

BitField.description: This field controls the fractional divide value

BitField.description: This field controls the fractional divide value

BitField.name: PFD3_STABLE
BitField.description: This read-only bitfield is for DIAGNOSTIC PURPOSES ONLY since the fractional divider should become stable quickly enough that this field will never need to be used by either device driver or application code

BitField.name: PFD2_STABLE
BitField.description: This read-only bitfield is for DIAGNOSTIC PURPOSES ONLY since the fractional divider should become stable quickly enough that this field will never need to be used by either device driver or application code

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ
BitField.description: Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

Enum.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ_0
Enum.description: Nominal VBG

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0
Enum.description: All analog except RTC powered down on stop mode assertion.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1
Enum.description: Beside RTC, analog bandgap, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2
Enum.description: Beside RTC, 1p1 and 2p5 regulators are also on, low-power bandgap is selected so that the normal analog bandgap together with the rest analog is powered down.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3
Enum.description: Beside RTC, low-power bandgap is selected and the rest analog is powered down.

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_0
Enum.description: Turn on the switch

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_1
Enum.description: Turn off the switch

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

Enum.name: MINUS_12_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 12.5%

Enum.name: MINUS_25_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 25.0%

Enum.name: MINUS_37_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 37.5%

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK
BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN
BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL
BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.

Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY
BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE
BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock

Enum.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE_0
Enum.description: Internal ring oscillator

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

BitField.name: PFD_480_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_480 clocks anytime the USB1_PLL_480 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: PFD_528_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_528 clocks anytime the PLL_528 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPPANIC
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor panic interrupt asserts for a panic high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPLOW
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor low interrupt asserts for low temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPHIGH
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor high interrupt asserts for high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_ANA_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the analog regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: IRQ_DIG_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the digital regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: REG0_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the CORE power domain

Enum.name: REG0_BO_OFFSET_4
Enum.description: Brownout offset = 0.100V

Enum.name: REG0_BO_OFFSET_7
Enum.description: Brownout offset = 0.175V

BitField.name: REG0_BO_STATUS
BitField.description: Reg0 brownout status bit.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

Enum.name: REG0_BO_STATUS_1
Enum.description: Brownout, supply is below target minus brownout offset.

BitField.name: REG0_ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Enables the brownout detection.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG0_OK
BitField.description: ARM supply Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: PLL3_DISABLE
BitField.description: When USB is in low power suspend mode this Control bit is used to indicate if other system peripherals require the USB PLL3 clock when the SoC is not in low power mode

Enum.name: PLL3_DISABLE_0
Enum.description: PLL3 is being used by peripherals and is enabled when SoC is not in any low power mode

Enum.name: PLL3_DISABLE_1
Enum.description: PLL3 can be disabled when the SoC is not in any low power mode

BitField.name: REG1_BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: This field defines the brown out voltage offset for the xPU power domain

Enum.name: REG1_BO_OFFSET_4
Enum.description: Brownout offset = 0.100V

Enum.name: REG1_BO_OFFSET_7
Enum.description: Brownout offset = 0.175V

BitField.name: REG1_BO_STATUS
BitField.description: Reg1 brownout status bit. Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

Enum.name: REG1_BO_STATUS_1
Enum.description: Brownout, supply is below target minus brownout offset.

BitField.name: REG1_ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Enables the brownout detection.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG1_OK
BitField.description: GPU supply Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: AUDIO_DIV_LSB
BitField.description: LSB of Post-divider for Audio PLL

Enum.name: AUDIO_DIV_LSB_0
Enum.description: divide by 1 (Default)

Enum.name: AUDIO_DIV_LSB_1
Enum.description: divide by 2

BitField.name: REG2_BO_OFFSET

Enum.name: REG2_BO_OFFSET_7

BitField.name: REG2_BO_STATUS
BitField.description: Reg2 brownout status bit.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG2_ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Enables the brownout detection.Not related to CCM. See Power Management Unit (PMU)

BitField.name: REG2_OK
BitField.description: Signals that the voltage is above the brownout level for the SOC supply

BitField.description: MSB of Post-divider for Audio PLL

Enum.name: AUDIO_DIV_MSB_0
Enum.description: divide by 1 (Default)

Enum.name: AUDIO_DIV_MSB_1
Enum.description: divide by 2

BitField.name: ENABLE_LINREG
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the regulator output.

BitField.name: ENABLE_BO
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the brownout circuitry in the regulator.

BitField.name: ENABLE_ILIMIT
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the current-limit circuitry in the regulator.

BitField.name: ENABLE_PULLDOWN
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the pull-down circuitry in the regulator

BitField.name: BO_OFFSET
BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator brownout offset voltage in 25mV steps

BitField.name: OUTPUT_TRG
BitField.description: Control bits to adjust the regulator output voltage

BitField.name: BO_VDD1P1
BitField.description: Status bit that signals when a brownout is detected on the regulator output.

BitField.name: OK_VDD1P1
BitField.description: Status bit that signals when the regulator output is ok. 1 = regulator output > brownout target

BitField.name: SELREF_WEAK_LINREG
BitField.description: Selects the source for the reference voltage of the weak 1p1 regulator.

Enum.name: SELREF_WEAK_LINREG_0
Enum.description: Weak-linreg output tracks low-power-bandgap voltage

Enum.name: SELREF_WEAK_LINREG_1
Enum.description: Weak-linreg output tracks VDD_SOC_IN voltage

Enum.description: Power gated off

Enum.name: REG0_TARG_1
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.725V

Enum.name: REG0_TARG_2
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.750V

Enum.name: REG0_TARG_3
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.775V

Enum.name: REG0_TARG_16
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 1.100V

Enum.name: REG0_TARG_30
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 1.450V

Enum.name: REG0_TARG_31
Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.

BitField.name: REG0_ADJ
BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg0. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

Enum.name: REG0_ADJ_0
Enum.description: No adjustment

BitField.name: REG1_TARG
BitField.description: This bit field defines the target voltage for the vpu/gpu power domain. Single bit increments reflect 25mV core voltage steps. Not all steps will make sense to use either because of input supply limitations or load operation.

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_0
Enum.description: Power gated off

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_1
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.725V

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_2
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.750V

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_3
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.775V

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_16
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 1.100V

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_30
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 1.450V

Enum.name: REG1_TARG_31
Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.

BitField.name: REG1_ADJ
BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg1. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

Enum.name: REG1_ADJ_0
Enum.description: No adjustment

BitField.name: REG2_TARG
BitField.description: This field defines the target voltage for the SOC power domain

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_0
Enum.description: Power gated off

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_1
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.725V

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_2
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.750V

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_3
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 0.775V

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_16
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 1.100V

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_30
Enum.description: Target core voltage = 1.450V

Enum.name: REG2_TARG_31
Enum.description: Power FET switched full on. No regulation.

BitField.name: REG2_ADJ
BitField.description: This bit field defines the adjustment bits to calibrate the target value of Reg2. The adjustment is applied on top on any adjustment applied to the global reference in the misc0 register.

Enum.name: REG2_ADJ_0
Enum.description: No adjustment

Enum.name: RAMP_RATE_1
Enum.description: Medium Fast

Enum.name: RAMP_RATE_2
Enum.description: Medium Slow

BitField.description: If set, increases the gate drive on power gating FETs to reduce leakage in the off state

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWDVBGUP
BitField.description: Control bit to power down the VBG-up detection circuitry in the analog bandgap.

BitField.name: REFTOP_LOWPOWER
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the low-power mode in the analog bandgap.

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

Enum.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ_0
Enum.description: Nominal VBG

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable. 1 - Stable.

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0
Enum.description: SUSPEND (DSM)

Enum.name: STANDBY
Enum.description: Analog regulators are ON.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2
Enum.description: STOP (lower power)

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3
Enum.description: STOP (very lower power)

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_0
Enum.description: Turn on the switch

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_1
Enum.description: Turn off the switch

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

Enum.name: MINUS_12_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 12.5%

Enum.name: MINUS_25_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 25.0%

Enum.name: MINUS_37_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 37.5%

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK
BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN
BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL
BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.

Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY
BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE
BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.

Enum.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE_0
Enum.description: Internal ring oscillator

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWDVBGUP
BitField.description: Control bit to power down the VBG-up detection circuitry in the analog bandgap.

BitField.name: REFTOP_LOWPOWER
BitField.description: Control bit to enable the low-power mode in the analog bandgap.

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

Enum.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ_0
Enum.description: Nominal VBG

BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable. 1 - Stable.

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

BitField.name: PFD_480_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_480 clocks anytime the USB1_PLL_480 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: PFD_528_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_528 clocks anytime the PLL_528 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPPANIC
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor panic interrupt asserts for a panic high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPLOW
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor low interrupt asserts for low temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPHIGH
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor high interrupt asserts for high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_ANA_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the analog regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: IRQ_DIG_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the digital regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: PFD_480_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_480 clocks anytime the USB1_PLL_480 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: PFD_528_AUTOGATE_EN
BitField.description: This enables a feature that will clkgate (reset) all PFD_528 clocks anytime the PLL_528 is unlocked or powered off

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPPANIC
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor panic interrupt asserts for a panic high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPLOW
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor low interrupt asserts for low temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_TEMPHIGH
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when the temperature sensor high interrupt asserts for high temperature

BitField.name: IRQ_ANA_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the analog regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: IRQ_DIG_BO
BitField.description: This status bit is set to one when when any of the digital regulator brownout interrupts assert

BitField.name: POWER_DOWN
BitField.description: This bit powers down the temperature sensor.

Enum.name: POWER_UP
Enum.description: Enable power to the temperature sensor.

Enum.name: POWER_DOWN
Enum.description: Power down the temperature sensor.

Enum.name: STOP
Enum.description: Do not start the measurement process.

Enum.name: START
Enum.description: Start the measurement process.

BitField.name: FINISHED
BitField.description: Indicates that the latest temp is valid

Enum.name: INVALID
Enum.description: Last measurement is not ready yet.

Enum.name: VALID
Enum.description: Last measurement is valid.

BitField.name: TEMP_CNT
BitField.description: This bit field contains the last measured temperature count.

BitField.name: ALARM_VALUE
BitField.description: This bit field contains the temperature count (raw sensor output) that will generate a high alarm when TEMP_CNT is smaller than this field

BitField.name: CHK_CONTACT
BitField.description: Check the contact of USB plug

Enum.name: NO_CHECK
Enum.description: Do not check the contact of USB plug.

Enum.name: CHECK
Enum.description: Check whether the USB plug has been in contact with each other

Enum.name: CHECK
Enum.description: Check whether a charger (either a dedicated charger or a host charger) is connected to USB port.

Enum.name: NO_CHECK
Enum.description: Do not check whether a charger is connected to the USB port.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Enable the charger detector.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Disable the charger detector.

Enum.name: GOOD_CONTACT
Enum.description: The USB plug has made good contact.

BitField.description: State of charger detection. This bit is a read only version of the state of the analog signal.

Enum.description: The USB port is not connected to a charger.

Enum.name: CHARGER_PRESENT
Enum.description: A charger (either a dedicated charger or a host charger) is connected to the USB port.

Enum.name: SILICON_REVISION_7143424
Enum.description: Silicon revision 1.0

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

Enum.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ_0
Enum.description: Nominal VBG

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.Not related to oscillator.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0
Enum.description: All analog except rtc powered down on stop mode assertion. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1
Enum.description: Certain analog functions such as certain regulators left up. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2
Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=on, New BG=off.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3
Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=off, New BG=on.

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_0
Enum.description: Turn on the switch

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_1
Enum.description: Turn off the switch

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

Enum.name: MINUS_12_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 12.5%

Enum.name: MINUS_25_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 25.0%

Enum.name: MINUS_37_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 37.5%

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK
BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN
BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL
BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.

Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY
BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

BitField.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE
BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.

Enum.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE_0
Enum.description: Internal ring oscillator

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

BitField.name: VID_PLL_PREDIV
BitField.description: Predivider for the source clock of the PLL's. Not related to oscillator.

Enum.name: VID_PLL_PREDIV_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1

Enum.name: VID_PLL_PREDIV_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2

BitField.description: This field indicates which chip source is being used for the rtc clock.

Enum.name: RTC_XTAL_SOURCE_0
Enum.description: Internal ring oscillator

BitField.name: XTAL_24M_PWD
BitField.description: This field powers down the 24M crystal oscillator if set true.

BitField.name: VID_PLL_PREDIV
BitField.description: Predivider for the source clock of the PLL's. Not related to oscillator.

Enum.name: VID_PLL_PREDIV_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1

Enum.name: VID_PLL_PREDIV_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2

BitField.name: REFTOP_PWD
BitField.description: Control bit to power-down the analog bandgap reference circuitry

BitField.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF
BitField.description: Control bit to disable the self-bias circuit in the analog bandgap

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_0
Enum.description: Uses coarse bias currents for startup

Enum.name: REFTOP_SELFBIASOFF_1
Enum.description: Uses bandgap-based bias currents for best performance.

Enum.name: REFTOP_VBGADJ_0
Enum.description: Nominal VBG

BitField.name: REFTOP_VBGUP
BitField.description: Status bit that signals the analog bandgap voltage is up and stable

BitField.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG
BitField.description: Configure the analog behavior in stop mode.Not related to oscillator.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_0
Enum.description: All analog except rtc powered down on stop mode assertion. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_1
Enum.description: Certain analog functions such as certain regulators left up. XtalOsc=on, RCOsc=off;

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_2
Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=on, New BG=off.

Enum.name: STOP_MODE_CONFIG_3
Enum.description: XtalOsc=off, RCOsc=on, Old BG=off, New BG=on.

BitField.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS
BitField.description: This bit controls a switch from VDD_HIGH_IN to VDD_SNVS_IN.

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_0
Enum.description: Turn on the switch

Enum.name: DISCON_HIGH_SNVS_1
Enum.description: Turn off the switch

BitField.name: OSC_I
BitField.description: This field determines the bias current in the 24MHz oscillator

Enum.name: MINUS_12_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 12.5%

Enum.name: MINUS_25_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 25.0%

Enum.name: MINUS_37_5_PERCENT
Enum.description: Decrease current by 37.5%

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK
BitField.description: Status bit that signals that the output of the 24-MHz crystal oscillator is stable

BitField.name: OSC_XTALOK_EN
BitField.description: This bit enables the detector that signals when the 24MHz crystal oscillator is stable.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_CTRL
BitField.description: This bit allows disabling the clock gate (always ungated) for the xtal 24MHz clock that clocks the digital logic in the analog block

Enum.name: ALLOW_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Allow the logic to automatically gate the clock when the XTAL is powered down.

Enum.name: NO_AUTO_GATE
Enum.description: Prevent the logic from ever gating off the clock.

BitField.name: CLKGATE_DELAY
BitField.description: This field specifies the delay between powering up the XTAL 24MHz clock and releasing the clock to the digital logic inside the analog block

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start/stop bit for the RC tuning calculation logic. If stopped the tuning logic is reset.

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enables the tuning logic to calculate new RC tuning values

BitField.name: BYPASS
BitField.description: Bypasses any calculated RC tuning value and uses the programmed register value.

BitField.name: INVERT
BitField.description: Invert the stepping of the calculated RC tuning value.

BitField.name: RC_OSC_PROG_CUR
BitField.description: The current tuning value in use.

BitField.name: ENVADJ
BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

BitField.name: DISCONADJ
BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

BitField.name: ENVADJ
BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

BitField.name: DISCONADJ
BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

BitField.name: ENVADJ
BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

BitField.name: DISCONADJ
BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

BitField.name: ENVADJ
BitField.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

BitField.name: DISCONADJ
BitField.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector: 000 = Trip-Level Voltage is 0

BitField.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
BitField.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector

BitField.name: ENIRQHOSTDISCON
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for detection of disconnection to Device when in high-speed host mode

BitField.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in high-speed mode

BitField.name: ENDEVPLUGINDETECT
BitField.description: For device mode, enables 200-KOhm pullups for detecting connectivity to the host.

BitField.name: DEVPLUGIN_POLARITY
BitField.description: For device mode, if this bit is cleared to 0, then it trips the interrupt if the device is plugged in

BitField.name: OTG_ID_CHG_IRQ
BitField.description: OTG ID change interrupt. Indicates the value of ID pin changed.

BitField.name: ENOTGIDDETECT
BitField.description: Enables circuit to detect resistance of MiniAB ID pin.

BitField.name: RESUMEIRQSTICKY
BitField.description: Set to 1 will make RESUME_IRQ bit a sticky bit until software clear it

BitField.name: ENIRQRESUMEDETECT
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for detection of a non-J state on the USB line

BitField.name: RESUME_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after suspend

BitField.name: ENIRQDEVPLUGIN
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for the detection of connectivity to the USB line.

BitField.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that the device is connected

BitField.name: DATA_ON_LRADC
BitField.description: Enables the LRADC to monitor USB_DP and USB_DM. This is for use in non-USB modes only.

BitField.name: ENUTMILEVEL2
BitField.description: Enables UTMI+ Level2. This should be enabled if needs to support LS device

BitField.name: ENIRQWAKEUP
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for the wakeup events.

BitField.name: WAKEUP_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that there is a wakeup event

BitField.name: ENAUTO_PWRON_PLL
BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-enable the POWER bit of HW_CLKCTRL_PLLxCTRL0 if there is wakeup event if USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE
BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the CLKGATE bit if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD
BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in USBPHYx_PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENDPDMCHG_WKUP
BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if DP/DM is toggled when USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENIDCHG_WKUP
BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if ID is toggled when USB is suspended.

BitField.name: ENVBUSCHG_WKUP
BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if VBUS is toggled when USB is suspended.

BitField.name: FSDLL_RST_EN
BitField.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.

BitField.name: OTG_ID_VALUE
BitField.description: Almost same as OTGID_STATUS in USBPHYx_STATUS Register

BitField.name: HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0
BitField.description: Forces the next FS packet that is transmitted to have a EOP with LS timing

BitField.name: UTMI_SUSPENDM
BitField.description: Used by the PHY to indicate a powered-down state

BitField.name: SFTRST
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the USBPHYx_PWD, USBPHYx_TX, USBPHYx_RX, and USBPHYx_CTRL registers

BitField.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
BitField.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector

BitField.name: ENIRQHOSTDISCON
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for detection of disconnection to Device when in high-speed host mode

BitField.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in high-speed mode

BitField.name: ENDEVPLUGINDETECT
BitField.description: For device mode, enables 200-KOhm pullups for detecting connectivity to the host.

BitField.name: DEVPLUGIN_POLARITY
BitField.description: For device mode, if this bit is cleared to 0, then it trips the interrupt if the device is plugged in

BitField.name: OTG_ID_CHG_IRQ
BitField.description: OTG ID change interrupt. Indicates the value of ID pin changed.

BitField.name: ENOTGIDDETECT
BitField.description: Enables circuit to detect resistance of MiniAB ID pin.

BitField.name: RESUMEIRQSTICKY
BitField.description: Set to 1 will make RESUME_IRQ bit a sticky bit until software clear it

BitField.name: ENIRQRESUMEDETECT
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for detection of a non-J state on the USB line

BitField.name: RESUME_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after suspend

BitField.name: ENIRQDEVPLUGIN
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for the detection of connectivity to the USB line.

BitField.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that the device is connected

BitField.name: DATA_ON_LRADC
BitField.description: Enables the LRADC to monitor USB_DP and USB_DM. This is for use in non-USB modes only.

BitField.name: ENUTMILEVEL2
BitField.description: Enables UTMI+ Level2. This should be enabled if needs to support LS device

BitField.name: ENIRQWAKEUP
BitField.description: Enables interrupt for the wakeup events.

BitField.name: WAKEUP_IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates that there is a wakeup event

BitField.name: ENAUTO_PWRON_PLL
BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-enable the POWER bit of HW_CLKCTRL_PLLxCTRL0 if there is wakeup event if USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE
BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the CLKGATE bit if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD
BitField.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in USBPHYx_PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENDPDMCHG_WKUP
BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if DP/DM is toggled when USB is suspended

BitField.name: ENIDCHG_WKUP
BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if ID is toggled when USB is suspended.

BitField.name: ENVBUSCHG_WKUP
BitField.description: Enables the feature to wakeup USB if VBUS is toggled when USB is suspended.

BitField.name: FSDLL_RST_EN
BitField.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.

BitField.name: OTG_ID_VALUE
BitField.description: Almost same as OTGID_STATUS in USBPHYx_STATUS Register

BitField.name: HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0
BitField.description: Forces the next FS packet that is transmitted to have a EOP with LS timing

BitField.name: UTMI_SUSPENDM
BitField.description: Used by the PHY to indicate a powered-down state

BitField.name: SFTRST
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the USBPHYx_PWD, USBPHYx_TX, USBPHYx_RX, and USBPHYx_CTRL registers

BitField.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
BitField.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector

BitField.name: ENIRQHOSTDISCON

BitField.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS
BitField.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected while in high-speed host mode.

BitField.name: DEVPLUGIN_STATUS
BitField.description: Indicates that the device has been connected on the USB_DP and USB_DM lines.

BitField.name: OTGID_STATUS
BitField.description: Indicates the results of ID pin on MiniAB plug

BitField.name: RESUME_STATUS
BitField.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after suspend and has triggered an interrupt.

BitField.name: OTGIDPIOLOCK
BitField.description: Once OTG ID from USBPHYx_STATUS_OTGID_STATUS, use this to hold the value

BitField.name: DEBUG_INTERFACE_HOLD
BitField.description: Use holding registers to assist in timing for external UTMI interface.

BitField.name: HSTPULLDOWN
BitField.description: Set bit 3 to 1 to pull down 15-KOhm on USB_DP line

BitField.name: ENHSTPULLDOWN
BitField.description: Set bit 5 to 1 to override the control of the USB_DP 15-KOhm pulldown

BitField.name: TX2RXCOUNT
BitField.description: Delay in between the end of transmit to the beginning of receive

BitField.name: ENTX2RXCOUNT
BitField.description: Set this bit to allow a countdown to transition in between TX and RX.

BitField.name: SQUELCHRESETCOUNT
BitField.description: Delay in between the detection of squelch to the reset of high-speed RX.

BitField.name: ENSQUELCHRESET
BitField.description: Set bit to allow squelch to reset high-speed receive.

BitField.name: SQUELCHRESETLENGTH
BitField.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.

BitField.name: HOST_RESUME_DEBUG
BitField.description: Choose to trigger the host resume SE0 with HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0 = 0 or UTMI_SUSPEND = 1.

BitField.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MAJOR field of the RTL version.

Enum.description: The secure user read access is enabled for the second slave.

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Revision number of the controller core.

BitField.name: PHYW
BitField.description: Data width of the transciever connected to the controller core. PHYW bit reset value is

Enum.name: PHYW_0
Enum.description: 8 bit wide data bus Software non-programmable

Enum.name: PHYW_1
Enum.description: 16 bit wide data bus Software non-programmable

Enum.name: PHYW_2
Enum.description: Reset to 8 bit wide data bus Software programmable

Enum.name: PHYW_3
Enum.description: Reset to 16 bit wide data bus Software programmable

Enum.name: PHYM_1
Enum.description: ULPI DDR

Enum.name: PHYM_3
Enum.description: Serial Only

Enum.name: PHYM_4
Enum.description: Software programmable - reset to UTMI/UTMI+

Enum.name: PHYM_5
Enum.description: Software programmable - reset to ULPI DDR

Enum.name: PHYM_6
Enum.description: Software programmable - reset to ULPI

Enum.name: PHYM_7
Enum.description: Software programmable - reset to Serial

Enum.name: SM_0
Enum.description: No Serial Engine, always use parallel signalling.

Enum.name: SM_1
Enum.description: Serial Engine present, always use serial signalling for FS/LS.

Enum.name: SM_2
Enum.description: Software programmable - Reset to use parallel signalling for FS/LS

Enum.name: SM_3
Enum.description: Software programmable - Reset to use serial signalling for FS/LS

BitField.name: HC
BitField.description: Host Capable. Indicating whether host operation mode is supported or not.

Enum.name: HC_0
Enum.description: Not supported

BitField.name: NPORT
BitField.description: The Nmber of downstream ports supported by the host controller is (NPORT+1)

BitField.name: DC
BitField.description: Device Capable. Indicating whether device operation mode is supported or not.

Enum.name: DC_0
Enum.description: Not supported

BitField.name: TXBURST
BitField.description: Default burst size for memory to TX buffer transfer

BitField.name: TXCHANADD
BitField.description: TX FIFO Buffer size is: (2^TXCHANADD) * 4 Bytes

BitField.name: RXBURST
BitField.description: Default burst size for memory to RX buffer transfer

BitField.name: RXADD
BitField.description: Buffer total size for all receive endpoints is (2^RXADD)

BitField.name: GPTLD
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Load Value These bit fields are loaded to GPTCNT bits when GPTRST bit is set '1b'

BitField.name: GPTCNT
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Counter. This field is the count value of the countdown timer.

BitField.name: GPTMODE
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Mode In one shot mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt, and stop until the counter is reset by software; In repeat mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt and automatically reload the counter value from GPTLD bits to start again

Enum.name: GPTMODE_0
Enum.description: One Shot Mode

Enum.name: GPTMODE_1
Enum.description: Repeat Mode

Enum.name: GPTRST_0
Enum.description: No action

Enum.name: GPTRST_1
Enum.description: Load counter value from GPTLD bits in n_GPTIMER0LD

BitField.name: GPTRUN
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Run GPTCNT bits are not effected when setting or clearing this bit.

Enum.name: GPTRUN_0
Enum.description: Stop counting

BitField.name: GPTLD
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Load Value These bit fields are loaded to GPTCNT bits when GPTRST bit is set '1b'

BitField.name: GPTCNT
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Counter. This field is the count value of the countdown timer.

BitField.name: GPTMODE
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Mode In one shot mode, the timer will count down to zero, generate an interrupt, and stop until the counter is reset by software

Enum.name: GPTMODE_0
Enum.description: One Shot Mode

Enum.name: GPTMODE_1
Enum.description: Repeat Mode

Enum.name: GPTRST_0
Enum.description: No action

Enum.name: GPTRST_1
Enum.description: Load counter value from GPTLD bits in USB_n_GPTIMER0LD

BitField.name: GPTRUN
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer Run GPTCNT bits are not effected when setting or clearing this bit.

Enum.name: GPTRUN_0
Enum.description: Stop counting

BitField.name: AHBBRST
BitField.description: AHB master interface Burst configuration These bits control AHB master transfer type sequence (or priority)

Enum.name: AHBBRST_0
Enum.description: Incremental burst of unspecified length only

Enum.name: AHBBRST_1
Enum.description: INCR4 burst, then single transfer

Enum.name: AHBBRST_2
Enum.description: INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then single transfer

Enum.name: AHBBRST_3
Enum.description: INCR16 burst, INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then single transfer

Enum.name: AHBBRST_5
Enum.description: INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

Enum.name: AHBBRST_6
Enum.description: INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

Enum.name: AHBBRST_7
Enum.description: INCR16 burst, INCR8 burst, INCR4 burst, then incremental burst of unspecified length

BitField.name: CAPLENGTH
BitField.description: These bits are used as an offset to add to register base to find the beginning of the Operational Register

BitField.name: HCIVERSION
BitField.description: Host Controller Interface Version Number Default value is '10h', which means EHCI rev1.0.

BitField.name: PPC
BitField.description: Port Power Control This field indicates whether the host controller implementation includes port power control

BitField.name: N_PCC
BitField.description: Number of Ports per Companion Controller This field indicates the number of ports supported per internal Companion Controller

Enum.name: N_CC_0
Enum.description: There is no internal Companion Controller and port-ownership hand-off is not supported.

Enum.name: N_CC_1
Enum.description: There are internal companion controller(s) and port-ownership hand-offs is supported.

BitField.name: PI
BitField.description: Port Indicators (P INDICATOR) This bit indicates whether the ports support port indicator control

BitField.name: N_PTT
BitField.description: Number of Ports per Transaction Translator (N_PTT)

BitField.name: ADC
BitField.description: 64-bit Addressing Capability This bit is set '0b' in all controller core, no 64-bit addressing capability is supported

BitField.name: PFL
BitField.description: Programmable Frame List Flag If this bit is set to zero, then the system software must use a frame list length of 1024 elements with this host controller

BitField.name: ASP
BitField.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Capability If this bit is set to a one, then the host controller supports the park feature for high-speed queue heads in the Asynchronous Schedule

BitField.name: DCIVERSION
BitField.description: Device Controller Interface Version Number Default value is '01h', which means rev0.1.

BitField.name: DEN
BitField.description: Device Endpoint Number This field indicates the number of endpoints built into the device controller

BitField.name: DC
BitField.description: Device Capable When this bit is 1, this controller is capable of operating as a USB 2.0 device.

BitField.name: HC
BitField.description: Host Capable When this bit is 1, this controller is capable of operating as an EHCI compatible USB 2

Enum.name: PSE_0
Enum.description: Do not process the Periodic Schedule

Enum.name: PSE_1
Enum.description: Use the PERIODICLISTBASE register to access the Periodic Schedule.

Enum.name: ASE_0
Enum.description: Do not process the Asynchronous Schedule.

Enum.name: ASE_1
Enum.description: Use the ASYNCLISTADDR register to access the Asynchronous Schedule.

BitField.name: IAA
BitField.description: Interrupt on Async Advance Doorbell - Read/Write

BitField.name: ASP
BitField.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Mode Count - Read/Write

BitField.name: ASPE
BitField.description: Asynchronous Schedule Park Mode Enable - Read/Write

BitField.name: FS_2
BitField.description: Frame List Size - (Read/Write or Read Only)

Enum.name: FS_2_0
Enum.description: 1024 elements (4096 bytes) Default value

Enum.name: FS_2_1
Enum.description: 512 elements (2048 bytes)

Enum.name: ITC_0
Enum.description: Immediate (no threshold)

Enum.name: ITC_1
Enum.description: 1 micro-frame

Enum.name: ITC_2
Enum.description: 2 micro-frames

Enum.name: ITC_4
Enum.description: 4 micro-frames

Enum.name: ITC_8
Enum.description: 8 micro-frames

Enum.name: ITC_16
Enum.description: 16 micro-frames

Enum.name: ITC_32
Enum.description: 32 micro-frames

Enum.name: ITC_64
Enum.description: 64 micro-frames

BitField.name: UE
BitField.description: USB Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: UEE
BitField.description: USB Error Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UEI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: PCE
BitField.description: Port Change Detect Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the PCI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: FRE
BitField.description: Frame List Rollover Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the FRI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: SEE
BitField.description: System Error Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SEI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: AAE
BitField.description: Async Advance Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the AAI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: URE
BitField.description: USB Reset Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the URI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: SRE
BitField.description: SOF Received Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SRI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: SLE
BitField.description: Sleep Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the SLI bit in n_n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: ULPIE
BitField.description: ULPI Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the UPLII bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: NAKE
BitField.description: NAK Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the NAKI bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: UAIE
BitField.description: USB Host Asynchronous Interrupt Enable When this bit is one, and the UAI bit in the n_USBSTS register is one, host controller will issue an interrupt at the next interrupt threshold

BitField.name: UPIE
BitField.description: USB Host Periodic Interrupt Enable When this bit is one, and the UPI bit in the n_USBSTS register is one, host controller will issue an interrupt at the next interrupt threshold

BitField.name: TIE0
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer #0 Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the TI0 bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: TIE1
BitField.description: General Purpose Timer #1 Interrupt Enable When this bit is one and the TI1 bit in n_USBSTS register is a one the controller will issue an interrupt

BitField.name: USBADR
BitField.description: Device Address. These bits correspond to the USB device address

BitField.name: CF
BitField.description: Configure Flag Host software sets this bit as the last action in its process of configuring the Host Controller

Enum.name: CF_0
Enum.description: Port routing control logic default-routes each port to an implementation dependent classic host controller.

Enum.name: CF_1
Enum.description: Port routing control logic default-routes all ports to this host controller.

Enum.name: OCA_0
Enum.description: This port does not have an over-current condition.

Enum.name: OCA_1
Enum.description: This port currently has an over-current condition

BitField.name: PR
BitField.description: Port Reset - Read/Write or Read Only

Enum.name: PIC_0
Enum.description: Port indicators are off

Enum.name: PTC_3
Enum.description: SE0 (host) / NAK (device)

BitField.name: PHCD
BitField.description: PHY Low Power Suspend - Clock Disable (PLPSCD) - Read/Write

Enum.name: PHCD_0
Enum.description: Enable PHY clock

Enum.name: PHCD_1
Enum.description: Disable PHY clock

BitField.name: PFSC
BitField.description: Port Force Full Speed Connect - Read/Write

Enum.name: PFSC_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: PFSC_1
Enum.description: Forced to full speed

BitField.name: PSPD
BitField.description: Port Speed - Read Only. This register field indicates the speed at which the port is operating.

Enum.name: PSPD_0
Enum.description: Full Speed

Enum.name: PSPD_1
Enum.description: Low Speed

Enum.name: PSPD_2
Enum.description: High Speed

BitField.name: PTW
BitField.description: Parallel Transceiver Width This bit has no effect if serial interface engine is used

Enum.name: PTW_0
Enum.description: Select the 8-bit UTMI interface [60MHz]

Enum.name: PTW_1
Enum.description: Select the 16-bit UTMI interface [30MHz]

BitField.name: STS
BitField.description: Serial Transceiver Select 1 Serial Interface Engine is selected 0 Parallel Interface signals is selected Serial Interface Engine can be used in combination with UTMI+/ULPI physical interface to provide FS/LS signaling instead of the parallel interface signals

BitField.name: PTS_1
BitField.description: All USB port interface modes are listed in this field description, but not all are supported

BitField.name: VD
BitField.description: VBUS_Discharge - Read/Write. Setting this bit causes VBus to discharge through a resistor.

BitField.name: IDPU
BitField.description: ID Pullup - Read/Write This bit provide control over the ID pull-up resistor; 0 = off, 1 = on [default]

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: USB ID - Read Only. 0 = A device, 1 = B device

BitField.name: AVV
BitField.description: A VBus Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the A VBus valid threshold.

BitField.name: ASV
BitField.description: A Session Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the A session valid threshold.

BitField.name: BSV
BitField.description: B Session Valid - Read Only. Indicates VBus is above the B session valid threshold.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: B Session End - Read Only. Indicates VBus is below the B session end threshold.

BitField.name: TOG_1MS
BitField.description: 1 millisecond timer toggle - Read Only. This bit toggles once per millisecond.

BitField.name: DPS
BitField.description: Data Bus Pulsing Status - Read Only

BitField.name: AVVIS
BitField.description: A VBus Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: ASVIS
BitField.description: A Session Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: BSVIS
BitField.description: B Session Valid Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: BSEIS
BitField.description: B Session End Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: STATUS_1MS
BitField.description: 1 millisecond timer Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: DPIS
BitField.description: Data Pulse Interrupt Status - Read/Write to Clear

BitField.name: IDIE
BitField.description: USB ID Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the USB ID interrupt.

BitField.name: AVVIE
BitField.description: A VBus Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the A VBus valid interrupt.

BitField.name: ASVIE
BitField.description: A Session Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write

BitField.name: BSVIE
BitField.description: B Session Valid Interrupt Enable - Read/Write

BitField.name: BSEIE
BitField.description: B Session End Interrupt Enable - Read/Write. Setting this bit enables the B session end interrupt.

Enum.name: CM_0
Enum.description: Idle [Default for combination host/device]

Enum.name: CM_2
Enum.description: Device Controller [Default for device only controller]

Enum.name: CM_3
Enum.description: Host Controller [Default for host only controller]

Enum.name: ES_0
Enum.description: Little Endian [Default]

Enum.name: ES_1
Enum.description: Big Endian

Enum.name: SLOM_0
Enum.description: Setup Lockouts On (default);

Enum.name: SLOM_1
Enum.description: Setup Lockouts Off (DCD requires use of Setup Data Buffer Tripwire in USBCMDUSB Command Register .

BitField.name: ERBR
BitField.description: Endpoint Receive Buffer Ready -- Read Only

BitField.name: ETBR
BitField.description: Endpoint Transmit Buffer Ready -- Read Only

BitField.name: RXS
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK

BitField.name: RXT
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control Endpoint0 is fixed as a Control End Point.

BitField.name: RXE
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Enable 1 Enabled Endpoint0 is always enabled.

BitField.name: TXS
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK [Default] 1 End Point Stalled Software can write a one to this bit to force the endpoint to return a STALL handshake to the Host

BitField.name: TXT
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 - Control Endpoint0 is fixed as a Control End Point.

BitField.name: TXE
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Enable 1 Enabled Endpoint0 is always enabled.

BitField.name: RXS
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK

BitField.name: RXD
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Data Sink - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [Default] Should always be written as zero

BitField.name: RXT
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

BitField.name: RXI
BitField.description: RX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled This bit is only used for test and should always be written as zero

BitField.name: RXR
BitField.description: RX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the host and device

BitField.name: RXE
BitField.description: RX Endpoint Enable 0 Disabled [Default] 1 Enabled An Endpoint should be enabled only after it has been configured

BitField.name: TXS
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Stall - Read/Write 0 End Point OK 1 End Point Stalled This bit will be cleared automatically upon receipt of a SETUP request if this Endpoint is configured as a Control Endpoint and this bit will continue to be cleared by hardware until the associated ENDPTSETUPSTAT bit is cleared

BitField.name: TXD
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Data Source - Read/Write 0 Dual Port Memory Buffer/DMA Engine [DEFAULT] Should always be written as 0

BitField.name: TXT
BitField.description: TX Endpoint Type - Read/Write 00 Control 01 Isochronous 10 Bulk 11 Interrupt

BitField.name: TXI
BitField.description: TX Data Toggle Inhibit 0 PID Sequencing Enabled

BitField.name: TXR
BitField.description: TX Data Toggle Reset (WS) Write 1 - Reset PID Sequence Whenever a configuration event is received for this Endpoint, software must write a one to this bit in order to synchronize the data PID's between the Host and device

Enum.name: OVER_CUR_DIS_0
Enum.description: Enables overcurrent detection

Enum.name: OVER_CUR_DIS_1
Enum.description: Disables overcurrent detection

BitField.name: OVER_CUR_POL
BitField.description: OTG1 Polarity of Overcurrent The polarity of OTG1 port overcurrent event

Enum.name: OVER_CUR_POL_0
Enum.description: High active (high on this signal represents an overcurrent condition)

Enum.name: OVER_CUR_POL_1
Enum.description: Low active (low on this signal represents an overcurrent condition)

BitField.name: PWR_POL
BitField.description: OTG1 Power Polarity This bit should be set according to PMIC Power Pin polarity.

Enum.name: PWR_POL_0
Enum.description: PMIC Power Pin is Low active.

Enum.name: PWR_POL_1
Enum.description: PMIC Power Pin is High active.

BitField.name: WIE
BitField.description: OTG1 Wake-up Interrupt Enable This bit enables or disables the OTG1 wake-up interrupt

Enum.name: WIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt Disabled

Enum.name: WIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt Enabled

Enum.name: WKUP_SW_1
Enum.description: Force wake-up

BitField.name: WKUP_ID_EN
BitField.description: OTG1 Wake-up on ID change enable

BitField.name: WKUP_VBUS_EN
BitField.description: OTG1 wake-up on VBUS change enable

Enum.name: WKUP_DPDM_EN_0
Enum.description: DPDM changes wake-up to be disabled only when VBUS is 0.

Enum.name: WKUP_DPDM_EN_1
Enum.description: (Default) DPDM changes wake-up to be enabled, it is for device only.

BitField.name: WIR
BitField.description: OTG1 Wake-up Interrupt Request This bit indicates that a wake-up interrupt request is received on the OTG1 port

Enum.name: WIR_0
Enum.description: No wake-up interrupt request received

Enum.name: WIR_1
Enum.description: Wake-up Interrupt Request received

BitField.name: UTMI_CLK_VLD
BitField.description: Indicating whether OTG1 UTMI PHY clock is valid

Enum.name: EDBG_0
Enum.description: When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.

Enum.name: EDBG_1
Enum.description: When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.

Enum.name: ERCA_0
Enum.description: Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection .

Enum.name: ERCA_1
Enum.description: Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection .

Enum.name: HOE_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: HOE_1
Enum.description: Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.

Enum.name: HALT_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: HALT_1
Enum.description: Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.

Enum.name: CLM_0
Enum.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

Enum.name: CLM_1
Enum.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.

Enum.name: EMLM_0
Enum.description: Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

Enum.name: EMLM_1
Enum.description: Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.

Enum.name: ECX_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: ECX_1
Enum.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.

Enum.name: CX_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: CX_1
Enum.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.

Enum.name: ACTIVE_0
Enum.description: eDMA is idle.

Enum.name: ACTIVE_1
Enum.description: eDMA is executing a channel.

Enum.name: DBE_0
Enum.description: No destination bus error

Enum.name: DBE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write

Enum.name: SBE_0
Enum.description: No source bus error

Enum.name: SBE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read

Enum.name: SGE_0
Enum.description: No scatter/gather configuration error

Enum.name: SGE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.

Enum.name: NCE_0
Enum.description: No NBYTES/CITER configuration error

Enum.name: NCE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]

Enum.name: DOE_0
Enum.description: No destination offset configuration error

Enum.name: DOE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

Enum.name: DAE_0
Enum.description: No destination address configuration error

Enum.name: DAE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

Enum.name: SOE_0
Enum.description: No source offset configuration error

Enum.name: SOE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

Enum.name: SAE_0
Enum.description: No source address configuration error.

Enum.name: SAE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

BitField.name: ERRCHN
BitField.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

Enum.name: CPE_0
Enum.description: No channel priority error

Enum.name: CPE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities . Channel priorities are not unique.

Enum.name: ECX_0
Enum.description: No canceled transfers

Enum.name: ECX_1
Enum.description: The last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

Enum.name: VLD_0
Enum.description: No ERR bits are set.

Enum.name: VLD_1
Enum.description: At least one ERR bit is set indicating a valid error exists that has not been cleared.

BitField.name: DPA
BitField.description: Disable Preempt Ability. This field resets to 0.

Enum.name: DPA_0
Enum.description: Channel n can suspend a lower priority channel.

Enum.name: DPA_1
Enum.description: Channel n cannot suspend any channel, regardless of channel priority.

BitField.name: ECP
BitField.description: Enable Channel Preemption. This field resets to 0.

Enum.name: ECP_0
Enum.description: Channel n cannot be suspended by a higher priority channel's service request.

Enum.name: ECP_1
Enum.description: Channel n can be temporarily suspended by the service request of a higher priority channel.

Enum.name: SSIZE_5
Enum.description: 32-byte burst (4 beats of 64 bits)

Enum.name: SMOD_0
Enum.description: Source address modulo feature is disabled

Enum.name: SMOD_1
Enum.description: This value defines a specific address range specified to be the value after SADDR + SOFF calculation is performed on the original register value. Setting this field provides the ability to implement a circular data queue easily. For data queues requiring power-of-2 size bytes, the queue should start at a 0-modulo-size address and the SMOD field should be set to the appropriate value for the queue, freezing the desired number of upper address bits. The value programmed into this field specifies the number of lower address bits allowed to change. For a circular queue application, the SOFF is typically set to the transfer size to implement post-increment addressing with the SMOD function constraining the addresses to a 0-modulo-size range.

Enum.name: SMOD_2
