Register.name: TCD0_NBYTES_MLNO
Register.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

Register.name: TCD0_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD0_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

BitField.name: MLOFF
BitField.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD0_CITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD0_CITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD0_DLASTSGA
Register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Register.name: TCD0_BITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD0_BITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD1_CITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD1_CITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD1_DLASTSGA
Register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Enum.name: SSIZE_5
Enum.description: 32-byte burst (4 beats of 64 bits)

Enum.name: SMOD_0
Enum.description: Source address modulo feature is disabled

Enum.name: SMOD_1
Enum.description: This value defines a specific address range specified to be the value after SADDR + SOFF calculation is performed on the original register value. Setting this field provides the ability to implement a circular data queue easily. For data queues requiring power-of-2 size bytes, the queue should start at a 0-modulo-size address and the SMOD field should be set to the appropriate value for the queue, freezing the desired number of upper address bits. The value programmed into this field specifies the number of lower address bits allowed to change. For a circular queue application, the SOFF is typically set to the transfer size to implement post-increment addressing with the SMOD function constraining the addresses to a 0-modulo-size range.

The value programmed into this field specifies the number of lower address bits allowed to change. For a circular queue application, the SOFF is typically set to the transfer size to implement post-increment addressing with the SMOD function constraining the addresses to a 0-modulo-size range.

Register.name: TCD4_NBYTES_MLNO
Register.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

Register.name: TCD4_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD4_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

BitField.name: MLOFF
BitField.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD4_CITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD4_CITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD4_DLASTSGA
Register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.description: 32-byte burst (4 beats of 64 bits)

Enum.name: SMOD_0
Enum.description: Source address modulo feature is disabled

Enum.name: SMOD_1
Enum.description: This value defines a specific address range specified to be the value after SADDR + SOFF calculation is performed on the original register value. Setting this field provides the ability to implement a circular data queue easily. For data queues requiring power-of-2 size bytes, the queue should start at a 0-modulo-size address and the SMOD field should be set to the appropriate value for the queue, freezing the desired number of upper address bits. The value programmed into this field specifies the number of lower address bits allowed to change. For a circular queue application, the SOFF is typically set to the transfer size to implement post-increment addressing with the SMOD function constraining the addresses to a 0-modulo-size range.

Register.name: TCD7_NBYTES_MLNO
Register.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

Register.name: TCD7_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD7_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

BitField.name: MLOFF
BitField.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD7_CITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD7_CITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD7_DLASTSGA
Register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD9_CITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD9_DLASTSGA
Register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Register.name: TCD9_BITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD9_BITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Enum.name: SSIZE_5
Enum.description: 32-byte burst (4 beats of 64 bits)

Enum.name: SMOD_0
Enum.description: Source address modulo feature is disabled

Enum.name: SMOD_1
Enum.description: This value defines a specific address range specified to be the value after SADDR + SOFF calculation is performed on the original register value. Setting this field provides the ability to implement a circular data queue easily. For data queues requiring power-of-2 size bytes, the queue should start at a 0-modulo-size address and the SMOD field should be set to the appropriate value for the queue, freezing the desired number of upper address bits. The value programmed into this field specifies the number of lower address bits allowed to change. For a circular queue application, the SOFF is typically set to the transfer size to implement post-increment addressing with the SMOD function constraining the addresses to a 0-modulo-size range.

Enum.name: SMOD_2
Enum.description: This value defines a specific address range specified to be the value after SADDR + SOFF calculation is performed on the original register value. The value programmed into this field specifies the number of lower address bits allowed to change. Register.name: TCD10_NBYTES_MLNO
Register.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

Register.name: TCD10_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD10_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

BitField.name: MLOFF
BitField.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD12_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

BitField.name: MLOFF
BitField.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1

Register.name: TCD12_CITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD12_CITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD12_DLASTSGA
Register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

For data queues requiring power-of-2 size bytes, the queue should start at a 0-modulo-size address and the SMOD field should be set to the appropriate value for the queue, freezing the desired number of upper address bits. The value programmed into this field specifies the number of lower address bits allowed to change. For a circular queue application, the SOFF is typically set to the transfer size to implement post-increment addressing with the SMOD function constraining the addresses to a 0-modulo-size range.

Register.name: TCD15_NBYTES_MLNO
Register.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

Register.name: TCD15_NBYTES_MLOFFNO
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD15_NBYTES_MLOFFYES
Register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

BitField.name: MLOFF
BitField.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

Enum.name: DMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: DMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_0
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

Enum.name: SMLOE_1
Enum.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

Register.name: TCD15_CITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD15_CITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD15_DLASTSGA
Register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Register.name: TCD15_BITER_ELINKNO
Register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Register.name: TCD15_BITER_ELINKYES
Register.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

BitField.name: ELINK
BitField.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

Enum.name: ELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled

Enum.name: ELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled

Enum.description: DMA Channel Always ON function is disabled

Enum.name: A_ON_1
Enum.description: DMA Channel Always ON function is enabled

Enum.description: Triggering is disabled. If triggering is disabled and ENBL is set, the DMA Channel will simply route the specified source to the DMA channel. (Normal mode)

Enum.name: TRIG_1
Enum.description: Triggering is enabled. If triggering is enabled and ENBL is set, the DMA_CH_MUX is in Periodic Trigger mode.

BitField.name: ENABLE_CONTEXT_SWITCHING
BitField.description: Enable automatic context switching for the channels

BitField.name: ENABLE_CONTEXT_CACHING
BitField.description: The software must set this bit to enable the caching of contexts between the operations

BitField.name: GATHER_RESIDUAL_WRITES
BitField.description: The software must set this bit to enable the ragged writes to the unaligned buffers to be gathered between multiple write operations

BitField.name: PRESENT_SHA
BitField.description: Indicates whether the SHA1/SHA2 functions are present.

BitField.name: PRESENT_CRYPTO
BitField.description: Indicates whether the crypto (cipher/hash) functions are present.

BitField.name: CLKGATE
BitField.description: This bit must be set to zero for a normal operation

BitField.name: SFTRST
BitField.description: Set this bit to zero to enable a normal DCP operation

BitField.name: IRQ
BitField.description: Indicates which channels have pending interrupt requests

BitField.name: READY_CHANNELS
BitField.description: Indicates which channels are ready to proceed with a transfer (the active channel is also included)

BitField.name: OTP_KEY_READY
BitField.description: When set, it indicates that the OTP key is shifted from the fuse block and is ready for use.

BitField.name: ENABLE_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field enables the DMA channel associated with it

BitField.name: HIGH_PRIORITY_CHANNEL
BitField.description: Setting a bit in this field causes the corresponding channel to have high-priority arbitration

BitField.name: CH0_IRQ_MERGED
BitField.description: Indicates that the interrupt for channel 0 must be merged with the other interrupts on the shared dcp_irq interrupt

BitField.name: NUM_KEYS
BitField.description: Encoded value indicating the number of key-storage locations implemented in the design

BitField.name: NUM_CHANNELS
BitField.description: Encoded value indicating the number of channels implemented in the design

BitField.name: DISABLE_UNIQUE_KEY
BitField.description: Write to a 1 to disable the per-device unique key

BitField.name: DISABLE_DECRYPT
BitField.description: Write to 1 to disable the decryption

BitField.name: CIPHER_ALGORITHMS
BitField.description: One-hot field indicating which cipher algorithms are available

BitField.name: HASH_ALGORITHMS
BitField.description: One-hot field indicating which hashing features are implemented in the hardware

BitField.name: INDEX
BitField.description: Key index pointer. The valid indices are 0-[number_keys].

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Word 0 data for the key. This is the least-significant word.

BitField.name: INTERRUPT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the channel must issue an interrupt upon the completion of the packet.

BitField.name: DECR_SEMAPHORE
BitField.description: Reflects whether the channel's semaphore must be decremented at the end of the current operation

BitField.name: CHAIN
BitField.description: Reflects whether the next command pointer register must be loaded into the channel's current descriptor pointer

BitField.name: CHAIN_CONTIGUOUS
BitField.description: Reflects whether the next packet's address is located following this packet's payload.

BitField.name: ENABLE_MEMCOPY
BitField.description: Reflects whether the selected hashing function should be enabled for this operation.

BitField.name: ENABLE_CIPHER
BitField.description: Reflects whether the selected cipher function must be enabled for this operation.

BitField.name: ENABLE_HASH
BitField.description: Reflects whether the selected hashing function must be enabled for this operation.

BitField.name: ENABLE_BLIT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP must perform a blit operation

BitField.name: CIPHER_ENCRYPT
BitField.description: When the cipher block is enabled, this bit indicates whether the operation is encryption or decryption

BitField.name: CIPHER_INIT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the cipher block must load the initialization vector from the payload for this operation

BitField.name: OTP_KEY
BitField.description: Reflects whether a hardware-based key must be used

BitField.name: PAYLOAD_KEY
BitField.description: When set, it indicates the payload contains the key

BitField.name: HASH_INIT
BitField.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the initial block in the hashing operation, so the hash registers must be initialized before the operation

BitField.name: HASH_TERM
BitField.description: Reflects whether the current hashing block is the final block in the hashing operation, so the hash padding must be applied by the hardware

BitField.name: CHECK_HASH
BitField.description: Reflects whether the calculated hash value must be compared to the hash provided in the payload.

BitField.name: HASH_OUTPUT
BitField.description: When the hashing is enabled, this bit controls whether the input or output data is hashed.

BitField.name: CONSTANT_FILL
BitField.description: When this bit is set (MEMCOPY and BLIT modes only), the DCP simply fills the destination buffer with the value found in the source address field

BitField.name: TEST_SEMA_IRQ
BitField.description: This bit is used to test the channel semaphore transition to 0. FOR TEST USE ONLY!

BitField.name: KEY_BYTESWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key bytes (big-endian key).

BitField.name: KEY_WORDSWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine swaps the key words (big-endian key).

BitField.name: INPUT_BYTESWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the input data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: INPUT_WORDSWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the input data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: OUTPUT_BYTESWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine byteswaps the output data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: OUTPUT_WORDSWAP
BitField.description: Reflects whether the DCP engine wordswaps the output data (big-endian data).

BitField.name: CIPHER_MODE
BitField.description: Cipher mode selection field. Reflects the mode of operation for the cipher operations.

BitField.name: CIPHER_CFG
BitField.description: Cipher configuration bits. Optional configuration bits are required for the ciphers.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Byte count register. This value is the working value and updates as the operation proceeds.

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: This regiser reflects the payload pointer for the current control packet.

Register.name: DCP_CH0CMDPTR
Register.description: DCP channel 0 command pointer address register

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Pointer to the descriptor structure to be processed for channel 0.

BitField.name: INCREMENT
BitField.description: The value written to this field is added to the semaphore count in an atomic way such that the simultaneous software adds and DCP hardware substracts happening on the same clock are protected

BitField.name: VALUE
BitField.description: This read-only field shows the current (instantaneous) value of the semaphore counter.

BitField.name: HASH_MISMATCH
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

BitField.name: ERROR_SETUP
BitField.description: This bit indicates that the hardware detected an invalid programming configuration (such as a buffer length that is not a multiple of the natural data size for the operation)

BitField.name: ERROR_PACKET
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading the packet or payload, or when writing the status back to the packet payload

BitField.name: ERROR_SRC
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading from the source buffer

BitField.name: ERROR_DST
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when storing to the destination buffer

BitField.name: ERROR_PAGEFAULT
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a page fault occurred while converting a virtual address to a physical address

BitField.name: ERROR_CODE
BitField.description: Indicates the additional error codes for some of the error conditions

Enum.name: NEXT_CHAIN_IS_0
Enum.description: Error signalled because the next pointer is 0x00000000

Enum.name: NO_CHAIN
Enum.description: Error signalled because the semaphore is non-zero and neither chain bit is set

Enum.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
Enum.description: Error signalled because an error is reported reading/writing the context buffer

Enum.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
Enum.description: Error signalled because an error is reported reading/writing the payload

Enum.name: INVALID_MODE
Enum.description: Error signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for instance, blit + hash)

BitField.name: TAG
BitField.description: Indicates the tag from the last completed packet in the command structure

BitField.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when reading from the source buffer

BitField.name: ERROR_DST
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a bus error occurred when storing to the destination buffer

BitField.name: ERROR_PAGEFAULT
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a page fault occurred while converting a virtual address to a physical address

BitField.name: ERROR_CODE
BitField.description: Indicates additional error codes for some of the error conditions.

Enum.name: NEXT_CHAIN_IS_0
Enum.description: Error is signalled because the next pointer is 0x00000000.

Enum.name: NO_CHAIN
Enum.description: Error is signalled because the semaphore is of a non-zero value and neither of the chain bits is set.

Enum.name: CONTEXT_ERROR
Enum.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported while reading/writing the context buffer.

Enum.name: PAYLOAD_ERROR
Enum.description: Error is signalled because an error was reported while reading/writing the payload.

Enum.name: INVALID_MODE
Enum.description: Error is signalled because the control packet specifies an invalid mode select (for example, blit + hash).

BitField.name: TAG
BitField.description: Indicates the tag from the last completed packet in the command structure.

BitField.name: HASH_MISMATCH
BitField.description: This bit indicates that a hashing check operation is mismatched for the control packets that enable the HASH_CHECK bit

BitField.name: ERROR_SETUP
BitField.description: This bit indicates that the hardware detected an invalid programming configuration (such as a buffer length that is not a multiple of the natural data size for the operation)

BitField.name: FLUSH
BitField.description: Page table flush control. To flush the TLB, write this bit to 1 and then back to 0.

Enum.name: MEGA_PDN_REQ_0
Enum.description: No Request

Enum.name: MEGA_PDN_REQ_1
Enum.description: Request power down sequence

Enum.name: MEGA_PUP_REQ_0
Enum.description: No Request

Enum.name: MEGA_PUP_REQ_1
Enum.description: Request power up sequence

Enum.name: PDRAM0_PGE_0
Enum.description: FlexRAM PDRAM0 domain will keep power even if the CPU core is powered down.

Enum.name: PDRAM0_PGE_1
Enum.description: FlexRAM PDRAM0 domain will be powered down when the CPU core is powered down..

BitField.name: IMR1
BitField.description: IRQ[31:0] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

BitField.name: IMR2
BitField.description: IRQ[63:32] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

BitField.name: IMR3
BitField.description: IRQ[95:64] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

BitField.name: IMR4
BitField.description: IRQ[127:96] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

BitField.name: IMR5
BitField.description: IRQ[159:128] masking bits: 1-irq masked, 0-irq is not masked

BitField.name: PCR
BitField.description: Power Control PCR must not change from power-down request (pdn_req) assertion until the target subsystem is completely powered up

Enum.name: PCR_0
Enum.description: Do not switch off power even if pdn_req is asserted.

Enum.name: PCR_1
Enum.description: Switch off power when pdn_req is asserted.

Register.name: PGC_MEGA_PUPSCR
Register.description: PGC Mega Power Up Sequence Control Register

BitField.name: SW
BitField.description: After a power-up request (pup_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of SW before asserting power toggle on/off signal (switch_b)

BitField.name: SW2ISO
BitField.description: After asserting power toggle on/off signal (switch_b), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of SW2ISO before negating isolation

Register.name: PGC_MEGA_PDNSCR
Register.description: PGC Mega Pull Down Sequence Control Register

BitField.name: ISO
BitField.description: After a power-down request (pdn_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of ISO before asserting isolation

BitField.name: ISO2SW
BitField.description: After asserting isolation, the PGC waits a number of IPG clocks equal to the value of ISO2SW before negating power toggle on/off signal (switch_b)

Register.name: PGC_MEGA_SR
Register.description: PGC Mega Power Gating Controller Status Register

Enum.name: PSR_0
Enum.description: The target subsystem was not powered down for the previous power-down request.

Enum.name: PSR_1
Enum.description: The target subsystem was powered down for the previous power-down request.

BitField.name: PCR
BitField.description: Power Control PCR must not change from power-down request (pdn_req) assertion until the target subsystem is completely powered up

Enum.name: PCR_0
Enum.description: Do not switch off power even if pdn_req is asserted.

Enum.name: PCR_1
Enum.description: Switch off power when pdn_req is asserted.

Register.name: PGC_CPU_PUPSCR
Register.description: PGC CPU Power Up Sequence Control Register

BitField.name: SW
BitField.description: There are two different silicon revisions: 1

BitField.name: SW2ISO
BitField.description: There are two different silicon revisions: 1

Register.name: PGC_CPU_PDNSCR
Register.description: PGC CPU Pull Down Sequence Control Register

BitField.name: ISO
BitField.description: After a power-down request (pdn_req assertion), the PGC waits a number of 32k clocks equal to the value of ISO before asserting isolation

BitField.name: ISO2SW
BitField.description: After asserting isolation, the PGC waits a number of 32k clocks equal to the value of ISO2SW before negating

Register.name: PGC_CPU_SR
Register.description: PGC CPU Power Gating Controller Status Register

Enum.name: PSR_0
Enum.description: The target subsystem was not powered down for the previous power-down request.

Enum.name: PSR_1
Enum.description: The target subsystem was powered down for the previous power-down request.

Enum.name: mask_wdog_rst_5
Enum.description: wdog_rst_b is masked

Enum.name: mask_wdog_rst_10
Enum.description: wdog_rst_b is not masked (default)

Enum.name: core0_rst_0
Enum.description: do not assert core0 reset

Enum.name: core0_rst_1
Enum.description: assert core0 reset

BitField.name: core0_dbg_rst
BitField.description: Software reset for core0 debug only

Enum.name: core0_dbg_rst_0
Enum.description: do not assert core0 debug reset

Enum.name: core0_dbg_rst_1
Enum.description: assert core0 debug reset

BitField.name: dbg_rst_msk_pg
BitField.description: Do not assert debug resets after power gating event of core

Enum.name: dbg_rst_msk_pg_0
Enum.description: do not mask core debug resets (debug resets will be asserted after power gating event)

Enum.name: dbg_rst_msk_pg_1
Enum.description: mask core debug resets (debug resets won't be asserted after power gating event)

Enum.name: mask_wdog3_rst_5
Enum.description: wdog3_rst_b is masked

Enum.name: mask_wdog3_rst_10
Enum.description: wdog3_rst_b is not masked

BitField.name: ipp_reset_b
BitField.description: Indicates whether reset was the result of ipp_reset_b pin (Power-up sequence)

Enum.name: ipp_reset_b_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of ipp_reset_b pin.

Enum.name: ipp_reset_b_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of ipp_reset_b pin.

BitField.name: lockup
BitField.description: Indicates a reset has been caused by CPU lockup.

Enum.name: lockup_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of the mentioned case.

Enum.name: lockup_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of the mentioned case.

BitField.name: csu_reset_b
BitField.description: Indicates whether the reset was the result of the csu_reset_b input.

Enum.name: csu_reset_b_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of the csu_reset_b event.

Enum.name: csu_reset_b_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of the csu_reset_b event.

BitField.name: ipp_user_reset_b
BitField.description: Indicates whether the reset was the result of the ipp_user_reset_b qualified reset.

Enum.name: ipp_user_reset_b_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of the ipp_user_reset_b qualified as COLD reset event.

Enum.name: ipp_user_reset_b_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of the ipp_user_reset_b qualified as COLD reset event.

Enum.name: wdog_rst_b_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of the watchdog time-out event.

Enum.name: wdog_rst_b_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of the watchdog time-out event.

BitField.name: jtag_rst_b
BitField.description: HIGH - Z JTAG reset. Indicates whether the reset was the result of HIGH-Z reset from JTAG.

Enum.name: jtag_rst_b_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of HIGH-Z reset from JTAG.

Enum.name: jtag_rst_b_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of HIGH-Z reset from JTAG.

Enum.name: jtag_sw_rst_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of the mentioned case.

Enum.name: jtag_sw_rst_1
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of the mentioned case.

Enum.name: wdog3_rst_b_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of the watchdog3 time-out event.

Enum.name: wdog3_rst_b_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of the watchdog3 time-out event.

Enum.name: tempsense_rst_b_0
Enum.description: Reset is not a result of software reset from Temperature Sensor.

Enum.name: tempsense_rst_b_1
Enum.description: Reset is a result of software reset from Temperature Sensor.

BitField.name: SEC_CONFIG
BitField.description: SECONFIG[1] shows the state of the SECONFIG[1] fuse

BitField.name: DIR_BT_DIS
BitField.description: DIR_BT_DIS shows the state of the DIR_BT_DIS fuse

BitField.name: BT_FUSE_SEL
BitField.description: BT_FUSE_SEL (connected to gpio bt_fuse_sel) shows the state of the BT_FUSE_SEL fuse

BitField.name: BMOD
BitField.description: BMOD[1:0] shows the latched state of the BOOT_MODE1 and BOOT_MODE0 signals on the rising edge of POR_B

BitField.name: PERSISTENT_ENTRY0
BitField.description: Holds entry function for core0 for waking-up from low power mode

BitField.name: PERSISTENT_ARG0
BitField.description: Holds argument of entry function for core0 for waking-up from low power mode

BitField.name: PERSIST_REDUNDANT_BOOT
BitField.description: This field identifies which image must be used - 0/1/2/3

BitField.name: PERSIST_SECONDARY_BOOT
BitField.description: This bit identifies which image must be used - primary and secondary

BitField.name: OSCNT
BitField.description: Oscillator ready counter value. These bits define value of 32KHz counter, that serve as counter for oscillator lock time (count to n+1 ckil's). This is used for oscillator lock time. Current estimation is ~5ms. This counter will be used in ignition sequence and in wake from stop sequence if sbyos bit was defined, to notify that on chip oscillator output is ready for the dpll_ip to use and only then the gate in dpll_ip can be opened.

BitField.name: COSC_EN
BitField.description: On chip oscillator enable bit - this bit value is reflected on the output cosc_en

Enum.name: COSC_EN_0
Enum.description: disable on chip oscillator

Enum.name: COSC_EN_1
Enum.description: enable on chip oscillator

BitField.name: REG_BYPASS_COUNT
BitField.description: Counter for analog_reg_bypass signal assertion after standby voltage request by PMIC_STBY_REQ

Enum.name: REG_BYPASS_COUNT_0
Enum.description: no delay

Enum.name: REG_BYPASS_COUNT_1
Enum.description: 1 CKIL clock period delay

Enum.name: REG_BYPASS_COUNT_63
Enum.description: 63 CKIL clock periods delay

Enum.name: RBC_EN_0
Enum.description: REG_BYPASS_COUNTER disabled

Enum.name: RBC_EN_1
Enum.description: REG_BYPASS_COUNTER enabled.

BitField.name: REF_EN_B
BitField.description: Status of the value of CCM_REF_EN_B output of ccm

Enum.name: REF_EN_B_0
Enum.description: value of CCM_REF_EN_B is '0'

Enum.name: REF_EN_B_1
Enum.description: value of CCM_REF_EN_B is '1'

Enum.name: CAMP2_READY_0
Enum.description: CAMP2 is not ready.

Enum.name: CAMP2_READY_1
Enum.description: CAMP2 is ready.

BitField.name: COSC_READY
BitField.description: Status indication of on board oscillator

Enum.name: COSC_READY_0
Enum.description: on board oscillator is not ready.

Enum.name: COSC_READY_1
Enum.description: on board oscillator is ready.

Enum.name: AHB_PODF_BUSY_0
Enum.description: divider is not busy and its value represents the actual division.

Enum.name: AHB_PODF_BUSY_1
Enum.description: divider is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the divider represents the previous value of the division factor, and after the handshake the written value of the ahb_podf will be applied.

Enum.name: FLEXSPI_PODF_BUSY_0
Enum.description: divider is not busy and its value represents the actual division.

Enum.name: FLEXSPI_PODF_BUSY_1
Enum.description: divider is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the divider represents the previous value of the division factor, and after the handshake the written value of the flexspi_podf will be applied.

Enum.name: PERCLK_PODF_BUSY_0
Enum.description: divider is not busy and its value represents the actual division.

Enum.name: PERCLK_PODF_BUSY_1
Enum.description: divider is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the divider represents the previous value of the division factor, and after the handshake the written value of the perclk_podf will be applied.

BitField.name: PERIPH_CLK_SEL_BUSY
BitField.description: Busy indicator for periph_clk_sel mux control.

Enum.name: PERIPH_CLK_SEL_BUSY_0
Enum.description: mux is not busy and its value represents the actual division.

Enum.name: PERIPH_CLK_SEL_BUSY_1
Enum.description: mux is busy with handshake process with module. The value read in the periph_clk_sel represents the previous value of select, and after the handshake periph_clk_sel value will be applied.

BitField.name: LPM
BitField.description: Setting the low power mode that system will enter on next assertion of dsm_request signal.

Enum.name: LPM_0
Enum.description: Remain in run mode

Enum.name: LPM_1
Enum.description: Transfer to wait mode

Enum.name: LPM_2
Enum.description: Transfer to stop mode

BitField.name: ARM_CLK_DIS_ON_LPM
BitField.description: Define if ARM clocks (arm_clk, soc_mxclk, soc_pclk, soc_dbg_pclk, vl_wrck) will be disabled on wait mode

Enum.name: ARM_CLK_DIS_ON_LPM_0
Enum.description: ARM clock enabled on wait mode.

Enum.name: ARM_CLK_DIS_ON_LPM_1
Enum.description: ARM clock disabled on wait mode. .

Enum.name: SBYOS_0
Enum.description: On-chip oscillator will not be powered down, after next entrance to STOP mode. (CCM_REF_EN_B will remain asserted - '0' and cosc_pwrdown will remain de asserted - '0')

Enum.name: SBYOS_1
Enum.description: On-chip oscillator will be powered down, after next entrance to STOP mode. (CCM_REF_EN_B will be deasserted - '1' and cosc_pwrdown will be asserted - '1'). When returning from STOP mode, external oscillator will be enabled again, on-chip oscillator will return to oscillator mode, and after oscnt count, CCM will continue with the exit from the STOP mode process.

BitField.name: DIS_REF_OSC
BitField.description: dis_ref_osc - in run mode, software can manually control closing of external reference oscillator clock, i

Enum.name: DIS_REF_OSC_0
Enum.description: external high frequency oscillator will be enabled, i.e. CCM_REF_EN_B = '0'.

Enum.name: DIS_REF_OSC_1
Enum.description: external high frequency oscillator will be disabled, i.e. CCM_REF_EN_B = '1'

Enum.name: VSTBY_0
Enum.description: Voltage will not be changed to standby voltage after next entrance to STOP mode. ( PMIC_STBY_REQ will remain negated - '0')

Enum.name: VSTBY_1
Enum.description: Voltage will be requested to change to standby voltage after next entrance to stop mode. ( PMIC_STBY_REQ will be asserted - '1').

Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_0
Enum.description: CCM will wait (1*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles

Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_1
Enum.description: CCM will wait (3*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles

Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_2
Enum.description: CCM will wait (7*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles

Enum.name: STBY_COUNT_3
Enum.description: CCM will wait (15*pmic_delay_scaler)+1 ckil clock cycles

BitField.name: COSC_PWRDOWN
BitField.description: In run mode, software can manually control powering down of on chip oscillator, i

Enum.name: COSC_PWRDOWN_0
Enum.description: On chip oscillator will not be powered down, i.e. cosc_pwrdown = '0'.

Enum.name: COSC_PWRDOWN_1
Enum.description: On chip oscillator will be powered down, i.e. cosc_pwrdown = '1'.

BitField.name: MASK_CORE0_WFI
BitField.description: Mask WFI of core0 for entering low power mode Assertion of all bits[27:22] will generate low power mode request

Enum.name: MASK_CORE0_WFI_0
Enum.description: WFI of core0 is not masked

Enum.name: MASK_CORE0_WFI_1
Enum.description: WFI of core0 is masked

BitField.name: MASK_SCU_IDLE
BitField.description: Mask SCU IDLE for entering low power mode Assertion of all bits[27:22] will generate low power mode request

Enum.name: MASK_SCU_IDLE_0
Enum.description: SCU IDLE is not masked

Enum.name: MASK_SCU_IDLE_1
Enum.description: SCU IDLE is masked

BitField.name: MASK_L2CC_IDLE

Enum.name: MASK_L2CC_IDLE_0
Enum.description: L2CC IDLE is not masked

Enum.name: MASK_L2CC_IDLE_1
Enum.description: L2CC IDLE is masked

Enum.description: interrupt is not generated due to lock ready of all enabled and not bypaseed PLLs

Enum.name: LRF_PLL_1
Enum.description: interrupt generated due to lock ready of all enabled and not bypaseed PLLs

Enum.description: PLL2 (divided by 2)

Enum.name: CLKO1_SEL_2

Enum.name: CLKO1_EN_1

Enum.name: CLK_OUT_SEL_1

Enum.description: divide by 4

BitField.name: PMIC_DELAY_SCALER
BitField.description: Defines clock dividion of clock for stby_count (pmic delay counter)

Enum.name: PMIC_DELAY_SCALER_0
Enum.description: clock is not divided

Enum.name: PMIC_DELAY_SCALER_1
Enum.description: clock is divided /8

BitField.name: EFUSE_PROG_SUPPLY_GATE
BitField.description: Defines the value of the output signal cgpr_dout[4]. Gate of program supply for efuse programing

Enum.name: EFUSE_PROG_SUPPLY_GATE_0
Enum.description: fuse programing supply voltage is gated off to the efuse module

Enum.name: EFUSE_PROG_SUPPLY_GATE_1
Enum.description: allow fuse programing.

Enum.name: SYS_MEM_DS_CTRL_0
Enum.description: Disable memory DS mode always

Enum.name: SYS_MEM_DS_CTRL_1
Enum.description: Enable memory (outside ARM platform) DS mode when system STOP and PLL are disabled

Enum.name: SYS_MEM_DS_CTRL_2
Enum.description: enable memory (outside ARM platform) DS mode when system is in STOP mode

Enum.name: FPL_0
Enum.description: Engage PLL enable default way.

Enum.name: FPL_1
Enum.description: Engage PLL enable 3 CKIL clocks earlier at exiting low power mode (STOP). Should be used only if 24MHz OSC was active in low power mode.

BitField.name: INT_MEM_CLK_LPM
BitField.description: Control for the Deep Sleep signal to the ARM Platform memories with additional control logic based on the ARM WFI signal

Enum.name: INT_MEM_CLK_LPM_0
Enum.description: Disable the clock to the ARM platform memories when entering Low Power Mode

Enum.name: INT_MEM_CLK_LPM_1
Enum.description: Keep the clocks to the ARM platform memories enabled only if an interrupt is pending when entering Low Power Modes (WAIT and STOP without power gating)

BitField.name: CG14
BitField.description: The OCRAM clock cannot be turned off when the CM cache is running on this device.

BitField.name: CG5
BitField.description: flexspi clocks (flexspi_clk_enable) sim_ems_clk_enable must also be cleared, when flexspi_clk_enable is cleared

BitField.name: MOD_EN_OV_GPT

Enum.name: MOD_EN_OV_GPT_0
Enum.description: don't override module enable signal

Enum.name: MOD_EN_OV_GPT_1
Enum.description: override module enable signal

BitField.name: MOD_EN_OV_PIT

Enum.name: MOD_EN_OV_PIT_0
Enum.description: don't override module enable signal

Enum.name: MOD_EN_OV_PIT_1
Enum.description: override module enable signal

BitField.name: MOD_EN_OV_TRNG
BitField.description: Overide clock enable signal from TRNG

Enum.name: MOD_EN_OV_TRNG_0
Enum.description: don't override module enable signal

Enum.name: MOD_EN_OV_TRNG_1

BitField.name: SOURCE

Enum.name: SOURCE_0
Enum.description: Address Comparator 0 matched

Enum.name: SOURCE_1
Enum.description: Address Comparator 1 matched

Enum.name: SOURCE_15
Enum.description: Address Comparator 15 matched

BitField.name: SW
BitField.description: ROMC AHB Multiple Address Comparator matches Indicator - Indicates that multiple address comparator matches occurred

Enum.name: SW_0
Enum.description: no event or comparator collisions

Enum.name: SW_1
Enum.description: a collision has occurred

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is ANDed with the input trigger.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[RXEDGIF] are disabled.

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: OSR_0

Enum.name: OSR_3

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 24.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 25.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 26.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 27.
