Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in the DATA register.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is ANDed with the input trigger.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[RXEDGIF] are disabled.

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is ANDed with the input trigger.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[RXEDGIF] are disabled.

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: OSR_0
Enum.description: Writing 0 to this field will result in an oversampling ratio of 16

Enum.name: OSR_3
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 4, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

Enum.name: OSR_4
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 5, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

Enum.name: OSR_5
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 6, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

Enum.name: OSR_6
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 7, requires BOTHEDGE to be set.

Enum.name: OSR_7
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 8.

Enum.name: OSR_8
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 9.

Enum.name: OSR_9
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 10.

Enum.name: OSR_10
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 11.

Enum.name: OSR_11
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 12.

Enum.name: OSR_12
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 13.

Enum.name: OSR_13
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 14.

Enum.name: OSR_14
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 15.

Enum.name: OSR_15
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 16.

Enum.name: OSR_16
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 17.

Enum.name: OSR_17
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 18.

Enum.name: OSR_18
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 19.

Enum.name: OSR_19
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 20.

Enum.name: OSR_20
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 21.

Enum.name: OSR_21
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 22.

Enum.name: OSR_22
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 23.

Enum.name: OSR_23
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 24.

Enum.name: OSR_24
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 25.

Enum.name: OSR_25
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 26.

Enum.name: OSR_26
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 27.

Enum.name: OSR_27
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 28.

Enum.name: OSR_28
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 29.

Enum.name: OSR_29
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 30.

Enum.name: OSR_30
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 31.

Enum.name: OSR_31
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 32.

Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in the DATA register.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is ANDed with the input trigger.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[RXEDGIF] are disabled.

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: OSR_0

Enum.name: OSR_3

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 10.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 15.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 17.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 18.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 19.

Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in the DATA register.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.

Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: PCSPOL_0

Enum.description: The Peripheral Chip Select pin PCSx is active high

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match is disabled

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: 010b - Match is enabled, if 1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1, i.e., (1st data word = MATCH0 + MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: 011b - Match is enabled, if any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1, i.e., (any data word = MATCH0 + MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: 100b - Match is enabled, if 1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1, i.e., [(1st data word = MATCH0) * (2nd data word = MATCH1)]

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: 101b - Match is enabled, if any data word equals MATCH0 AND the next data word equals MATCH1, i.e., [(any data word = MATCH0) * (next data word = MATCH1)]

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: 110b - Match is enabled, if (1st data word AND MATCH1) equals (MATCH0 AND MATCH1), i.e., [(1st data word * MATCH1) = (MATCH0 * MATCH1)]

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: 111b - Match is enabled, if (any data word AND MATCH1) equals (MATCH0 AND MATCH1), i.e., [(any data word * MATCH1) = (MATCH0 * MATCH1)]

Enum.name: PINCFG_0
Enum.description: SIN is used for input data and SOUT is used for output data

Enum.name: PINCFG_1
Enum.description: SIN is used for both input and output data

Enum.name: PINCFG_2
Enum.description: SOUT is used for both input and output data

Enum.name: PINCFG_3
Enum.description: SOUT is used for input data and SIN is used for output data

Enum.name: OUTCFG_0
Enum.description: Output data retains last value when chip select is negated

Enum.name: OUTCFG_1
Enum.description: Output data is tristated when chip select is negated

Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0] using high speed mode

Enum.name: CMD_7

Enum.name: SDF_1
Enum.description: Master has generated a STOP condition

Enum.name: ALF_1
Enum.description: Master has lost arbitration

Enum.description: No error

Enum.name: FEF_1
Enum.description: Master sending or receiving data without a START condition

Enum.name: PLTF_0

Enum.name: PLTF_1
Enum.description: Pin low timeout has occurred

Enum.name: DMF_0
Enum.description: Have not received matching data

Enum.name: DMF_1
Enum.description: Have received matching data

Enum.name: MBF_0

Enum.name: MBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Master is busy

Enum.description: I2C Bus is idle

Enum.name: BBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Bus is busy

Enum.name: TDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request is enabled

Enum.name: RDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request is disabled

Enum.name: RDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request is enabled

Enum.description: Host request input is enabled

Enum.name: HRPOL_1
Enum.description: Active high

Enum.name: HRSEL_0

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_0

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_1
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is enabled

Enum.name: RDMO_0
Enum.description: Received data is stored in the receive FIFO

Enum.name: RDMO_1
Enum.description: Received data is discarded unless the the Data Match Flag (MSR[DMF]) is set

Enum.name: PRESCALE_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1

Enum.name: PRESCALE_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2

Enum.name: PRESCALE_2
Enum.description: Divide by 4

Enum.name: PRESCALE_3
Enum.description: Divide by 8

Enum.name: PRESCALE_4
Enum.description: Divide by 16

Enum.name: PRESCALE_5
Enum.description: Divide by 32

Enum.name: PRESCALE_6
Enum.description: Divide by 64

Enum.name: PRESCALE_7
Enum.description: Divide by 128

Enum.name: AUTOSTOP_0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: AUTOSTOP_1
Enum.description: STOP condition is automatically generated whenever the transmit FIFO is empty and the LPI2C master is busy

Enum.name: IGNACK_0
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will receive ACK and NACK normally

Enum.name: IGNACK_1
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will treat a received NACK as if it (NACK) was an ACK

Enum.name: TIMECFG_0
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if SCL is low for longer than the configured timeout

Enum.name: TIMECFG_1
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if either SCL or SDA is low for longer than the configured timeout

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match is disabled

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match is enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match is enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match is enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match is enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match is enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match is enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1)

Enum.name: PINCFG_0
Enum.description: 2-pin open drain mode

Enum.name: PINCFG_1
Enum.description: 2-pin output only mode (ultra-fast mode)

Enum.name: PINCFG_2
Enum.description: 2-pin push-pull mode

Enum.name: PINCFG_3
Enum.description: 4-pin push-pull mode

Enum.name: PINCFG_4
Enum.description: 2-pin open drain mode with separate LPI2C slave

Enum.name: PINCFG_5
Enum.description: 2-pin output only mode (ultra-fast mode) with separate LPI2C slave

Enum.name: PINCFG_6
Enum.description: 2-pin push-pull mode with separate LPI2C slave

Enum.name: PINCFG_7
Enum.description: 4-pin push-pull mode (inverted outputs)

Enum.name: CMD_0
Enum.description: Transmit DATA[7:0]

Enum.name: CMD_1
Enum.description: Receive (DATA[7:0] + 1) bytes

Enum.name: CMD_2
Enum.description: Generate STOP condition

Enum.name: CMD_3
Enum.description: Receive and discard (DATA[7:0] + 1) bytes

Enum.name: CMD_4
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0]

Enum.name: CMD_5
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0]. This transfer expects a NACK to be returned.

Enum.name: CMD_6
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0] using high speed mode

Enum.name: CMD_7
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0] using high speed mode. This transfer expects a NACK to be returned.

Enum.name: SMOD_1
Enum.description: Receive mode. Captures the current Shifter content into the SHIFTBUF on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_2
Enum.description: Transmit mode. Load SHIFTBUF contents into the Shifter on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_4
Enum.description: Match Store mode. Shifter data is compared to SHIFTBUF content on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_5
Enum.description: Match Continuous mode. Shifter data is continuously compared to SHIFTBUF contents.

Enum.name: SMOD_6
Enum.description: State mode. SHIFTBUF contents are used for storing programmable state attributes.

Enum.name: SMOD_7
Enum.description: Logic mode. SHIFTBUF contents are used for implementing programmable logic look up table.

Enum.name: SSTART_0
Enum.description: Start bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store, transmitter loads data on enable

Enum.name: SSTART_1
Enum.description: Start bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store, transmitter loads data on first shift

Enum.name: SSTART_2
Enum.description: Transmitter outputs start bit value 0 before loading data on first shift, receiver/match store sets error flag if start bit is not 0

Enum.name: SSTART_3
Enum.description: Transmitter outputs start bit value 1 before loading data on first shift, receiver/match store sets error flag if start bit is not 1

Enum.name: SSTOP_0
Enum.description: Stop bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store

Enum.name: SSTOP_2
Enum.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 0 on store, receiver/match store sets error flag if stop bit is not 0

Enum.name: SSTOP_3
Enum.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 1 on store, receiver/match store sets error flag if stop bit is not 1

Enum.name: TIMRST_7

Enum.description: Decrement counter on Trigger input (both edges), Shift clock equals Trigger input.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_0
Enum.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_1
Enum.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_2
Enum.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload registers.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0.

BitField.name: FORCE_SEL
BitField.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_2
Enum.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_3
Enum.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_4
Enum.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_5
Enum.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_6
Enum.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_7
Enum.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FRCEN_0
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is disabled.

Enum.name: FRCEN_1
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is enabled.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_0
Enum.description: Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_1
Enum.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_2
Enum.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_3
Enum.description: EXT_SYNC causes initialization.

Enum.name: INDEP_0
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair.

Enum.name: INDEP_1
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs.

Enum.name: DBLEN_0
Enum.description: Double switching disabled.

Enum.name: DBLEN_1
Enum.description: Double switching enabled.

Enum.name: DBLX_0
Enum.description: PWMX double pulse disabled.

Enum.name: DBLX_1
Enum.description: PWMX double pulse enabled.

Enum.name: LDMOD_0
Enum.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect at the next PWM reload if MCTRL[LDOK] is set.

Enum.name: LDMOD_1
Enum.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF].

BitField.name: SPLIT
BitField.description: Split the DBLPWM signal to PWMA and PWMB

Enum.name: SPLIT_0
Enum.description: DBLPWM is not split. PWMA and PWMB each have double pulses.

Enum.name: SPLIT_1
Enum.description: DBLPWM is split to PWMA and PWMB.

Enum.name: PRSC_0
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk

Enum.name: PRSC_1
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/2

Enum.name: PRSC_2
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/4

Enum.name: PRSC_3
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/8

Enum.name: PRSC_4
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/16

Enum.name: PRSC_5
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/32

Enum.name: PRSC_6
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/64

Enum.name: PRSC_7
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/128

Enum.name: COMPMODE_0
Enum.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to" method. This means that PWM edges are only produced when the counter is equal to one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period will maintain this state until a match with VAL3 clears the output in the following period.

Enum.name: COMPMODE_1
Enum.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to or greater than" method. This means that PWM edges are produced when the counter is equal to or greater than one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period could go low at the start of the next period if the starting counter value is greater than (but not necessarily equal to) the new VAL3 value.

Enum.name: FULL_0
Enum.description: Full-cycle reloads disabled.

Enum.name: FULL_1
Enum.description: Full-cycle reloads enabled.

Enum.name: HALF_0
Enum.description: Half-cycle reloads disabled.

Enum.name: HALF_1
Enum.description: Half-cycle reloads enabled.
