Enum.description: Turn off fractional delay logic.

Enum.name: FRAC_PU_1
Enum.description: Power up fractional delay logic.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_0
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_1
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_2
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_3
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_0
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_1
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_2
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_3
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_0
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_1
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_2
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_3
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: POLX_0
Enum.description: PWM_X output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLX_1
Enum.description: PWM_X output inverted. A low level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLB_0
Enum.description: PWM_B output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLB_1
Enum.description: PWM_B output inverted. A low level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLA_0
Enum.description: PWM_A output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLA_1
Enum.description: PWM_A output inverted. A low level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: CMPF_0
Enum.description: No compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

Enum.name: CMPF_1
Enum.description: A compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

Enum.name: RF_0
Enum.description: No new reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

Enum.name: RF_1
Enum.description: New reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

Enum.name: REF_0
Enum.description: No reload error occurred.

Enum.name: REF_1
Enum.description: Reload signal occurred with non-coherent data and MCTRL[LDOK] = 0.

Enum.name: RUF_0
Enum.description: No register update has occurred since last reload.

Enum.name: RUF_1
Enum.description: At least one of the double buffered registers has been updated since the last reload.

Enum.name: CMPIE_0
Enum.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will not cause an interrupt request.

Enum.name: CMPIE_1
Enum.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will cause an interrupt request.

Enum.name: CX0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX0].

Enum.name: CX0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX0].

Enum.name: CX1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX1].

Enum.name: CX1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX1].

Enum.name: CB0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB0].

Enum.name: CB0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB0].

Enum.name: CB1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB1].

Enum.name: CB1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB1].

Enum.name: CA0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA0].

Enum.name: CA0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA0].

Enum.name: CA1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA1].

Enum.name: CA1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA1].

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

Enum.name: REIE_0
Enum.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

Enum.name: REIE_1
Enum.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

Enum.name: CAPTDE_0
Enum.description: Read DMA requests disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_1
Enum.description: Exceeding a FIFO watermark sets the DMA read request. This requires at least one of DMAEN[CA1DE], DMAEN[CA0DE], DMAEN[CB1DE], DMAEN[CB0DE], DMAEN[CX1DE], or DMAEN[CX0DE] to also be set in order to determine to which watermark(s) the DMA request is sensitive.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_2
Enum.description: A local sync (VAL1 matches counter) sets the read DMA request.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_3
Enum.description: A local reload (STS[RF] being set) sets the read DMA request.

Enum.name: FAND_0
Enum.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are OR'ed together.

Enum.name: FAND_1
Enum.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are AND'ed together.

Enum.name: VALDE_0
Enum.description: DMA write requests disabled

Enum.name: VALDE_1
Enum.description: DMA write requests for the VALx and FRACVALx registers enabled

Enum.name: OUT_TRIG_EN_0
Enum.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will not set when the counter value matches the VALx value.

Enum.name: OUT_TRIG_EN_1
Enum.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will set when the counter value matches the VALx value.

Enum.name: TRGFRQ_0
Enum.description: Trigger outputs are generated during every PWM period even if the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

Enum.name: TRGFRQ_1
Enum.description: Trigger outputs are generated only during the final PWM period prior to a reload opportunity when the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

Enum.name: PWBOT1_0
Enum.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port.

Enum.name: PWBOT1_1
Enum.description: Route the PWMB output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port.

Enum.name: PWAOT0_0
Enum.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port.

Enum.name: PWAOT0_1
Enum.description: Route the PWMA output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port.

Enum.name: ARMA_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMA_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLA[EDGAx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTA_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTA_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGA0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGA0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGA0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGA1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGA1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGA1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELA_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_A input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELA_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLA[EDGA0] and CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRA[EDGA0] and/or CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTA_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTA_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: ARMB_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMB_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLB[EDGBx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTB_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTB_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGB0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGB0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGB0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGB1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGB1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGB1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELB_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_B input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELB_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLB[EDGB0] and CAPTCTRLB[EDGB1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRB[EDGB0] and/or CAPTCTRLB[EDGB1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTB_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTB_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: ARMX_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMX_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLX[EDGXx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTX_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTX_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and the ARMX bit is cleared. No further captures will be performed until the ARMX bit is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and the ARMX bit is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGX0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGX0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGX0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGX1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGX1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGX1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELX_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_X input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELX_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLX[EDGX0] and CAPTCTRLX[EDGX1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRX[EDGX0] and/or CAPTCTRLX[EDGX1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTX_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTX_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_0
Enum.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_1
Enum.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_2
Enum.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload registers.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0.

BitField.name: FORCE_SEL
BitField.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_2
Enum.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_3
Enum.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_4
Enum.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_5
Enum.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_6
Enum.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_7
Enum.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FRCEN_0
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is disabled.

Enum.name: FRCEN_1
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is enabled.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_0
Enum.description: Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_1
Enum.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_2
Enum.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_3
Enum.description: EXT_SYNC causes initialization.

Enum.name: INDEP_0
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair.

Enum.name: INDEP_1
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs.

Enum.description: Double switching enabled.

Enum.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF].

Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_2
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_3
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: POLX_0
Enum.description: PWM_X output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLX_1
Enum.description: PWM_X output inverted. A low level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLB_0
Enum.description: PWM_B output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLB_1
Enum.description: PWM_B output inverted. A low level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLA_0
Enum.description: PWM_A output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLA_1
Enum.description: PWM_A output inverted. A low level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: CMPF_0
Enum.description: No compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

Enum.name: CMPF_1
Enum.description: A compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

Enum.name: RF_0
Enum.description: No new reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

Enum.name: RF_1
Enum.description: New reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

Enum.name: REF_0
Enum.description: No reload error occurred.

Enum.name: REF_1
Enum.description: Reload signal occurred with non-coherent data and MCTRL[LDOK] = 0.

Enum.name: RUF_0
Enum.description: No register update has occurred since last reload.

Enum.name: RUF_1
Enum.description: At least one of the double buffered registers has been updated since the last reload.

Enum.name: CMPIE_0
Enum.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will not cause an interrupt request.

Enum.name: CMPIE_1
Enum.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will cause an interrupt request.

Enum.name: CX0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX0].

Enum.name: CX0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX0].

Enum.name: CX1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX1].

Enum.name: CX1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX1].

Enum.name: CB0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB0].

Enum.name: CB0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB0].

Enum.name: CB1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB1].

Enum.name: CB1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB1].

Enum.name: CA0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA0].

Enum.name: CA0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA0].

Enum.name: CA1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA1].

Enum.name: CA1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA1].

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

Enum.name: REIE_0
Enum.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

Enum.name: REIE_1
Enum.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

Enum.name: CAPTDE_0
Enum.description: Read DMA requests disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_1
Enum.description: Exceeding a FIFO watermark sets the DMA read request. This requires at least one of DMAEN[CA1DE], DMAEN[CA0DE], DMAEN[CB1DE], DMAEN[CB0DE], DMAEN[CX1DE], or DMAEN[CX0DE] to also be set in order to determine to which watermark(s) the DMA request is sensitive.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_2
Enum.description: A local sync (VAL1 matches counter) sets the read DMA request.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_3
Enum.description: A local reload (STS[RF] being set) sets the read DMA request.

Enum.name: FAND_0
Enum.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are OR'ed together.

Enum.name: FAND_1
Enum.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are AND'ed together.

Enum.name: VALDE_0
Enum.description: DMA write requests disabled

Enum.name: VALDE_1
Enum.description: DMA write requests for the VALx and FRACVALx registers enabled

Enum.name: OUT_TRIG_EN_0
Enum.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will not set when the counter value matches the VALx value.

Enum.name: OUT_TRIG_EN_1
Enum.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will set when the counter value matches the VALx value.

Enum.name: TRGFRQ_0
Enum.description: Trigger outputs are generated during every PWM period even if the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

Enum.name: TRGFRQ_1
Enum.description: Trigger outputs are generated only during the final PWM period prior to a reload opportunity when the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

Enum.name: PWBOT1_0
Enum.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port.

Enum.name: PWBOT1_1
Enum.description: Route the PWMB output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port.

Enum.name: PWAOT0_0
Enum.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port.

Enum.name: PWAOT0_1
Enum.description: Route the PWMA output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port.

Enum.name: ARMA_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMA_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLA[EDGAx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTA_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTA_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGA0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGA0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGA0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGA1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGA1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGA1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELA_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_A input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELA_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLA[EDGA0] and CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRA[EDGA0] and/or CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTA_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTA_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: ARMB_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMB_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLB[EDGBx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTB_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTB_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGB0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGB0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGB0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGB1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGB1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGB1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELB_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_B input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELB_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLB[EDGB0] and CAPTCTRLB[EDGB1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRB[EDGB0] and/or CAPTCTRLB[EDGB1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTB_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTB_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: ARMX_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMX_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLX[EDGXx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTX_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTX_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and the ARMX bit is cleared. No further captures will be performed until the ARMX bit is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and the ARMX bit is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGX0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGX0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGX0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGX1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGX1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGX1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELX_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_X input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELX_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLX[EDGX0] and CAPTCTRLX[EDGX1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRX[EDGX0] and/or CAPTCTRLX[EDGX1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTX_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTX_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_0
Enum.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_1
Enum.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_2
Enum.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload registers.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0.

BitField.name: FORCE_SEL
BitField.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_2
Enum.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_3
Enum.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_4
Enum.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_5
Enum.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_6
Enum.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_7
Enum.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FRCEN_0
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is disabled.

Enum.name: FRCEN_1
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is enabled.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_0
Enum.description: Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_1
Enum.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_2
Enum.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_3
Enum.description: EXT_SYNC causes initialization.

Enum.name: INDEP_0
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair.

Enum.name: INDEP_1
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs.

Enum.name: DBLEN_0
Enum.description: Double switching disabled.

Enum.name: DBLEN_1
Enum.description: Double switching enabled.

Enum.name: DBLX_0
Enum.description: PWMX double pulse disabled.

Enum.name: DBLX_1
Enum.description: PWMX double pulse enabled.

Enum.name: LDMOD_0
Enum.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect at the next PWM reload if MCTRL[LDOK] is set.

Enum.name: LDMOD_1
Enum.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF].

BitField.name: SPLIT
BitField.description: Split the DBLPWM signal to PWMA and PWMB

Enum.name: SPLIT_0
Enum.description: DBLPWM is not split. PWMA and PWMB each have double pulses.

Enum.name: SPLIT_1
Enum.description: DBLPWM is split to PWMA and PWMB.

Enum.name: PRSC_0
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk

Enum.name: PRSC_1
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/2

Enum.name: PRSC_2
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/4

Enum.name: PRSC_3
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/8

Enum.name: PRSC_4
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/16

Enum.name: PRSC_5
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/32

Enum.name: PRSC_6
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/64

Enum.name: PRSC_7
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/128

Enum.name: COMPMODE_0
Enum.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to" method. This means that PWM edges are only produced when the counter is equal to one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period will maintain this state until a match with VAL3 clears the output in the following period.

Enum.name: COMPMODE_1
Enum.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to or greater than" method. This means that PWM edges are produced when the counter is equal to or greater than one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period could go low at the start of the next period if the starting counter value is greater than (but not necessarily equal to) the new VAL3 value.

Enum.name: FULL_0
Enum.description: Full-cycle reloads disabled.

Enum.name: FULL_1
Enum.description: Full-cycle reloads enabled.

Enum.name: HALF_0
Enum.description: Half-cycle reloads disabled.

Enum.name: HALF_1
Enum.description: Half-cycle reloads enabled.

Enum.name: LDFQ_0

Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTA_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGA0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGA0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGA0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGA1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGA1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGA1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELA_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_A input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELA_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLA[EDGA0] and CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRA[EDGA0] and/or CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTA_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTA_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: ARMB_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMB_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLB[EDGBx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTB_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTB_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is then cleared.

Enum.name: INP_SELB_1

Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLB[EDGB0] and CAPTCTRLB[EDGB1] fields are ignored. Enum.name: ARMX_0
Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.

Enum.name: ARMX_1
Enum.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLX[EDGXx] is enabled.

Enum.name: ONESHOTX_0
Enum.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

Enum.name: ONESHOTX_1
Enum.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and the ARMX bit is cleared. No further captures will be performed until the ARMX bit is set again.If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and the ARMX bit is then cleared.

Enum.name: EDGX0_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGX0_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGX0_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: EDGX1_1
Enum.description: Capture falling edges

Enum.name: EDGX1_2
Enum.description: Capture rising edges

Enum.name: EDGX1_3
Enum.description: Capture any edge

Enum.name: INP_SELX_0
Enum.description: Raw PWM_X input signal selected as source.

Enum.name: INP_SELX_1
Enum.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. Note that when this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLX[EDGX0] and CAPTCTRLX[EDGX1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRX[EDGX0] and/or CAPTCTRLX[EDGX1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.

Enum.name: EDGCNTX_EN_0
Enum.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

Enum.name: EDGCNTX_EN_1
Enum.description: Edge counter enabled

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_0
Enum.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_1
Enum.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.

Enum.name: CLK_SEL_2
Enum.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload registers.

Enum.name: RELOAD_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0.

BitField.name: FORCE_SEL
BitField.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_0
Enum.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_1
Enum.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_2
Enum.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_3
Enum.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_4
Enum.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_5
Enum.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_6
Enum.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FORCE_SEL_7
Enum.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates.

Enum.name: FRCEN_0
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is disabled.

Enum.name: FRCEN_1
Enum.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT is enabled.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_0
Enum.description: Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_1
Enum.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_2
Enum.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0.

Enum.name: INIT_SEL_3
Enum.description: EXT_SYNC causes initialization.

Enum.name: INDEP_0
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair.

Enum.name: INDEP_1
Enum.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs.

Enum.name: DBLEN_0
Enum.description: Double switching disabled.

Enum.name: DBLEN_1
Enum.description: Double switching enabled.

Enum.name: DBLX_0
Enum.description: PWMX double pulse disabled.

Enum.name: DBLX_1
Enum.description: PWMX double pulse enabled.

Enum.name: LDMOD_0
Enum.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect at the next PWM reload if MCTRL[LDOK] is set.

Enum.name: LDMOD_1
Enum.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF].

BitField.name: SPLIT
BitField.description: Split the DBLPWM signal to PWMA and PWMB

Enum.name: SPLIT_0
Enum.description: DBLPWM is not split. PWMA and PWMB each have double pulses.

Enum.name: SPLIT_1
Enum.description: DBLPWM is split to PWMA and PWMB.

Enum.name: PRSC_0
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk

Enum.name: PRSC_1
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/2

Enum.name: PRSC_2
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/4

Enum.name: PRSC_3
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/8

Enum.name: PRSC_4
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/16

Enum.name: PRSC_5
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/32

Enum.name: PRSC_6
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/64

Enum.name: PRSC_7
Enum.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/128

Enum.name: COMPMODE_0
Enum.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to" method. This means that PWM edges are only produced when the counter is equal to one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period will maintain this state until a match with VAL3 clears the output in the following period.

Enum.name: COMPMODE_1
Enum.description: The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to or greater than" method. This means that PWM edges are produced when the counter is equal to or greater than one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period could go low at the start of the next period if the starting counter value is greater than (but not necessarily equal to) the new VAL3 value.

Enum.name: FULL_0
Enum.description: Full-cycle reloads disabled.

Enum.name: FULL_1
Enum.description: Full-cycle reloads enabled.

Enum.name: HALF_0
Enum.description: Half-cycle reloads disabled.

Enum.name: HALF_1
Enum.description: Half-cycle reloads enabled.

Enum.name: LDFQ_0
Enum.description: Every PWM opportunity

Enum.name: LDFQ_1
Enum.description: Every 2 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_2
Enum.description: Every 3 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_3
Enum.description: Every 4 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_4
Enum.description: Every 5 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_5
Enum.description: Every 6 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_6
Enum.description: Every 7 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_7
Enum.description: Every 8 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_8
Enum.description: Every 9 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_9
Enum.description: Every 10 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_10
Enum.description: Every 11 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_11
Enum.description: Every 12 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_12
Enum.description: Every 13 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_13
Enum.description: Every 14 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_14
Enum.description: Every 15 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: LDFQ_15
Enum.description: Every 16 PWM opportunities

Enum.name: FRAC1_EN_0
Enum.description: Disable fractional cycle length for the PWM period.

Enum.name: FRAC1_EN_1
Enum.description: Enable fractional cycle length for the PWM period.

BitField.name: FRAC23_EN
BitField.description: Fractional Cycle Placement Enable for PWM_A

Enum.name: FRAC23_EN_0
Enum.description: Disable fractional cycle placement for PWM_A.

Enum.name: FRAC23_EN_1
Enum.description: Enable fractional cycle placement for PWM_A.

BitField.name: FRAC45_EN
BitField.description: Fractional Cycle Placement Enable for PWM_B

Enum.name: FRAC45_EN_0
Enum.description: Disable fractional cycle placement for PWM_B.

Enum.name: FRAC45_EN_1
Enum.description: Enable fractional cycle placement for PWM_B.

Enum.name: FRAC_PU_0
Enum.description: Turn off fractional delay logic.

Enum.name: FRAC_PU_1
Enum.description: Power up fractional delay logic.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_0
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_1
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_2
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMXFS_3
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_0
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_1
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_2
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMBFS_3
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_0
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_1
Enum.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_2
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: PWMAFS_3
Enum.description: Output is tristated.

Enum.name: POLX_0
Enum.description: PWM_X output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLX_1
Enum.description: PWM_X output inverted. A low level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLB_0
Enum.description: PWM_B output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLB_1
Enum.description: PWM_B output inverted. A low level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLA_0
Enum.description: PWM_A output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: POLA_1
Enum.description: PWM_A output inverted. A low level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state.

Enum.name: CMPF_0
Enum.description: No compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

Enum.name: CMPF_1
Enum.description: A compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value.

Enum.name: RF_0
Enum.description: No new reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

Enum.name: RF_1
Enum.description: New reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

Enum.name: REF_0
Enum.description: No reload error occurred.

Enum.name: REF_1
Enum.description: Reload signal occurred with non-coherent data and MCTRL[LDOK] = 0.

Enum.name: RUF_0
Enum.description: No register update has occurred since last reload.

Enum.name: RUF_1
Enum.description: At least one of the double buffered registers has been updated since the last reload.

Enum.name: CMPIE_0
Enum.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will not cause an interrupt request.

Enum.name: CMPIE_1
Enum.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will cause an interrupt request.

Enum.name: CX0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX0].

Enum.name: CX0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX0].

Enum.name: CX1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX1].

Enum.name: CX1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX1].

Enum.name: CB0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB0].

Enum.name: CB0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB0].

Enum.name: CB1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB1].

Enum.name: CB1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB1].

Enum.name: CA0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA0].

Enum.name: CA0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA0].

Enum.name: CA1IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA1].

Enum.name: CA1IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA1].

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

Enum.name: REIE_0
Enum.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

Enum.name: REIE_1
Enum.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

Enum.name: CAPTDE_0
Enum.description: Read DMA requests disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_1
Enum.description: Exceeding a FIFO watermark sets the DMA read request. This requires at least one of DMAEN[CA1DE], DMAEN[CA0DE], DMAEN[CB1DE], DMAEN[CB0DE], DMAEN[CX1DE], or DMAEN[CX0DE] to also be set in order to determine to which watermark(s) the DMA request is sensitive.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_2
Enum.description: A local sync (VAL1 matches counter) sets the read DMA request.

Enum.name: CAPTDE_3
Enum.description: A local reload (STS[RF] being set) sets the read DMA request.

Enum.name: FAND_0
Enum.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are OR'ed together.

Enum.name: FAND_1
Enum.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are AND'ed together.

Enum.name: VALDE_0
Enum.description: DMA write requests disabled

Enum.name: VALDE_1
Enum.description: DMA write requests for the VALx and FRACVALx registers enabled

Enum.name: OUT_TRIG_EN_0
Enum.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will not set when the counter value matches the VALx value.

Enum.name: OUT_TRIG_EN_1
Enum.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will set when the counter value matches the VALx value.

Enum.name: TRGFRQ_0
Enum.description: Trigger outputs are generated during every PWM period even if the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

Enum.name: TRGFRQ_1
Enum.description: Trigger outputs are generated only during the final PWM period prior to a reload opportunity when the PWM is not reloaded every period due to CTRL[LDFQ] being non-zero.

Enum.name: PWBOT1_0
Enum.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port.

Enum.name: PWBOT1_1
Enum.description: Route the PWMB output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port.

Enum.name: PWAOT0_0
Enum.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port.

Enum.name: PWAOT0_1
Enum.description: Route the PWMA output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port.

Enum.name: LDOK_0
Enum.description: Do not load new values.

Enum.name: LDOK_1
Enum.description: Load prescaler, modulus, and PWM values of the corresponding submodule.

Enum.name: RUN_0
Enum.description: PWM generator is disabled in the corresponding submodule.

Enum.name: RUN_1
Enum.description: PWM generator is enabled in the corresponding submodule.

Enum.name: IPOL_0
Enum.description: PWM23 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.

Enum.name: IPOL_1
Enum.description: PWM45 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.

Enum.name: MONPLL_0
Enum.description: Not locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software.

Enum.name: MONPLL_1
Enum.description: Not locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems.

Enum.name: MONPLL_2
Enum.description: Locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software. These bits are write protected until the next reset.

Enum.name: MONPLL_3
Enum.description: Locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems. These bits are write protected until the next reset.

Enum.name: FIE_0
Enum.description: FAULTx CPU interrupt requests disabled.

Enum.name: FIE_1
Enum.description: FAULTx CPU interrupt requests enabled.

Enum.name: FSAFE_0
Enum.description: Normal mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFPINx]. If neither FHALF nor FFULL is setm then the fault condition cannot be cleared. The PWM outputs disabled by this fault input will not be re-enabled until the actual FAULTx input signal de-asserts since the fault input will combinationally disable the PWM outputs (as programmed in DISMAPn).

Enum.name: FSAFE_1
Enum.description: Safe mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear and FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL]. If neither FHLAF nor FFULL is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared.

Enum.name: FAUTO_0
Enum.description: Manual fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL]. If neither FFULL nor FHALF is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared. This is further controlled by FCTRL[FSAFE].

Enum.name: FAUTO_1
Enum.description: Automatic fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are enabled when FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFLAGx]. If neither FFULL nor FHALF is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared.

Enum.name: FLVL_0
Enum.description: A logic 0 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.

Enum.name: FLVL_1
Enum.description: A logic 1 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.

Enum.name: FFLAG_0
Enum.description: No fault on the FAULTx pin.

Enum.name: FFLAG_1
Enum.description: Fault on the FAULTx pin.

Enum.name: FFULL_0
Enum.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

Enum.name: FFULL_1
Enum.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

Enum.name: FHALF_0
Enum.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a half cycle.

Enum.name: FHALF_1
Enum.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a half cycle (as defined by VAL0).

Enum.name: GSTR_0
Enum.description: Fault input glitch stretching is disabled.

Enum.name: GSTR_1
Enum.description: Input fault signals will be stretched to at least 2 IPBus clock cycles.

Enum.name: FTEST_0
Enum.description: No fault

Enum.name: FTEST_1
Enum.description: Cause a simulated fault

BitField.name: NOCOMB
BitField.description: No Combinational Path From Fault Input To PWM Output

Enum.name: NOCOMB_0
Enum.description: There is a combinational link from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs. The fault inputs are combined with the filtered and latched fault signals to disable the PWM outputs.

Enum.name: NOCOMB_1
Enum.description: The direct combinational path from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs is disabled and the filtered and latched fault signals are used to disable the PWM outputs.

Enum.description: No embedded U channel

Enum.name: USrc_Sel_1
Enum.description: U channel from SPDIF receive block (CD mode)

Enum.name: USrc_Sel_3
Enum.description: U channel from on chip transmitter

Enum.description: Bit clock is active low with drive outputs on falling edge and sample inputs on rising edge.

Enum.name: MSEL_2
Enum.description: Master Clock (MCLK) 2 option selected.

Enum.name: MSEL_3

Enum.name: BCI_1

Enum.name: BCS_0
Enum.description: Use the normal bit clock source.

Enum.name: BCS_1

Enum.name: SYNC_0
Enum.description: Asynchronous mode.

Enum.name: SYNC_1
Enum.description: Synchronous with receiver.

Enum.name: FSD_0
Enum.description: Frame sync is generated externally in Slave mode.

Enum.name: FSD_1
Enum.description: Frame sync is generated internally in Master mode.

Enum.name: FSP_0
Enum.description: Frame sync is active high.

Enum.name: FSP_1
Enum.description: Frame sync is active low.

Enum.name: ONDEM_0
Enum.description: Internal frame sync is generated continuously.

Enum.name: ONDEM_1
Enum.description: Internal frame sync is generated when the FIFO warning flag is clear.

Enum.name: FSE_0
Enum.description: Frame sync asserts with the first bit of the frame.

Enum.name: FSE_1
Enum.description: Frame sync asserts one bit before the first bit of the frame.

Enum.name: MF_0
Enum.description: LSB is transmitted first.

Enum.name: MF_1
Enum.description: MSB is transmitted first.

Enum.name: CHMOD_0
Enum.description: TDM mode, transmit data pins are tri-stated when slots are masked or channels are disabled.

Enum.name: CHMOD_1
Enum.description: Output mode, transmit data pins are never tri-stated and will output zero when slots are masked or channels are disabled.

Enum.name: FPACK_0
Enum.description: FIFO packing is disabled

Enum.name: FPACK_2
Enum.description: 8-bit FIFO packing is enabled

Enum.name: FPACK_3
Enum.description: 16-bit FIFO packing is enabled

Enum.name: FCOMB_0
Enum.description: FIFO combine mode disabled.

Enum.name: FCOMB_1
Enum.description: FIFO combine mode enabled on FIFO reads (from transmit shift registers).

Enum.name: FCOMB_2
Enum.description: FIFO combine mode enabled on FIFO writes (by software).

Enum.name: FCOMB_3
Enum.description: FIFO combine mode enabled on FIFO reads (from transmit shift registers) and writes (by software).

Enum.name: FCONT_0
Enum.description: On FIFO error, the SAI will continue from the start of the next frame after the FIFO error flag has been cleared.

Enum.name: FCONT_1
Enum.description: On FIFO error, the SAI will continue from the same word that caused the FIFO error to set after the FIFO warning flag has been cleared.

Enum.name: WCP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: WCP_1
Enum.description: FIFO combine is enabled for FIFO writes and this FIFO will be written on the next FIFO write.

Enum.name: WCP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: WCP_1
Enum.description: FIFO combine is enabled for FIFO writes and this FIFO will be written on the next FIFO write.

Enum.name: TWM_0
Enum.description: Word N is enabled.

Enum.name: TWM_1
Enum.description: Word N is masked. The transmit data pins are tri-stated or drive zero when masked.

Enum.description: 24M clock disabled

BitField.name: IM2
BitField.description: IM2 (bits 19-18, Input Capture Channel 2 operating mode) IM1 (bits 17-16, Input Capture Channel 1 operating mode) The IMn bit field determines the transition on the input pin (for Input capture channel n), which will trigger a capture event

Enum.name: IM2_0
Enum.description: capture disabled

Enum.name: IM2_1
Enum.description: capture on rising edge only

Enum.name: IM2_2
Enum.description: capture on falling edge only

Enum.name: IM2_3
Enum.description: capture on both edges

BitField.name: OM3
BitField.description: OM3 (bits 28-26) controls the Output Compare Channel 3 operating mode

Enum.name: OM3_0
Enum.description: Output disconnected. No response on pin.

Enum.name: OM3_1
Enum.description: Toggle output pin

Enum.name: OM3_2
Enum.description: Clear output pin

Enum.name: OM3_3
Enum.description: Set output pin

Enum.name: OM3_4
Enum.description: Generate an active low pulse (that is one input clock wide) on the output pin.

BitField.name: FO3
BitField.description: FO3 Force Output Compare Channel 3 FO2 Force Output Compare Channel 2 FO1 Force Output Compare Channel 1 The FOn bit causes the pin action programmed for the timer Output Compare n pin (according to the OMn bits in this register)

Enum.name: FO3_0
Enum.description: Writing a 0 has no effect.

Enum.name: FO3_1
Enum.description: Causes the programmed pin action on the timer Output Compare n pin; the OFn flag is not set.

Enum.name: PRESCALER_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1

Enum.name: PRESCALER_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2

Enum.name: PRESCALER_4095
Enum.description: Divide by 4096

Enum.name: PRESCALER24M_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1

Enum.name: PRESCALER24M_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2

Enum.name: PRESCALER24M_15
Enum.description: Divide by 16

BitField.name: OF3
BitField.description: OF3 Output Compare 3 Flag OF2 Output Compare 2 Flag OF1 Output Compare 1 Flag The OFn bit indicates that a compare event has occurred on Output Compare channel n

Enum.name: OF3_0
Enum.description: Compare event has not occurred.

Enum.name: OF3_1
Enum.description: Compare event has occurred.

BitField.name: IF2
BitField.description: IF2 Input capture 2 Flag IF1 Input capture 1 Flag The IFn bit indicates that a capture event has occurred on Input Capture channel n

Enum.name: IF2_0
Enum.description: Capture event has not occurred.

Enum.name: IF2_1
Enum.description: Capture event has occurred.

Enum.name: ROV_0
Enum.description: Rollover has not occurred.

Enum.name: ROV_1
Enum.description: Rollover has occurred.

BitField.name: OF3IE
BitField.description: OF3IE Output Compare 3 Interrupt Enable OF2IE Output Compare 2 Interrupt Enable OF1IE Output Compare 1 Interrupt Enable The OFnIE bit controls the Output Compare Channel n interrupt

Enum.name: OF3IE_0
Enum.description: Output Compare Channel n interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: OF3IE_1
Enum.description: Output Compare Channel n interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: IF2IE
BitField.description: IF2IE Input capture 2 Interrupt Enable IF1IE Input capture 1 Interrupt Enable The IFnIE bit controls the IFnIE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: IF2IE_0
Enum.description: IF2IE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable is disabled.

Enum.name: IF2IE_1
Enum.description: IF2IE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable is enabled.

BitField.name: ROVIE
BitField.description: Rollover Interrupt Enable. The ROVIE bit controls the Rollover interrupt.

Enum.name: ROVIE_0
Enum.description: Rollover interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: ROVIE_1
Enum.description: Rollover interrupt enabled.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Counter Value. The COUNT bits show the current count value of the GPT counter.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled.

Enum.name: ENMOD_0
Enum.description: GPT counter will retain its value when it is disabled.

Enum.name: ENMOD_1
Enum.description: GPT counter value is reset to 0 when it is disabled.

Enum.name: DBGEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: WAITEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in wait mode.

Enum.name: WAITEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in wait mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in doze mode.

Enum.name: STOPEN_0
Enum.description: GPT is disabled in Stop mode.

Enum.name: STOPEN_1
Enum.description: GPT is enabled in Stop mode.

Enum.name: OF3_0
Enum.description: Compare event has not occurred.

Enum.name: OF3_1
Enum.description: Compare event has occurred.

BitField.name: IF2
BitField.description: IF2 Input capture 2 Flag IF1 Input capture 1 Flag The IFn bit indicates that a capture event has occurred on Input Capture channel n

Enum.name: IF2_0
Enum.description: Capture event has not occurred.

Enum.name: IF2_1
Enum.description: Capture event has occurred.

Enum.name: ROV_0
Enum.description: Rollover has not occurred.

Enum.name: ROV_1
Enum.description: Rollover has occurred.

BitField.name: OF3IE
BitField.description: OF3IE Output Compare 3 Interrupt Enable OF2IE Output Compare 2 Interrupt Enable OF1IE Output Compare 1 Interrupt Enable The OFnIE bit controls the Output Compare Channel n interrupt

Enum.name: OF3IE_0
Enum.description: Output Compare Channel n interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: OF3IE_1
Enum.description: Output Compare Channel n interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: IF2IE
BitField.description: IF2IE Input capture 2 Interrupt Enable IF1IE Input capture 1 Interrupt Enable The IFnIE bit controls the IFnIE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: IF2IE_0
Enum.description: IF2IE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable is disabled.

Enum.name: IF2IE_1
Enum.description: IF2IE Input Capture n Interrupt Enable is enabled.

BitField.name: ROVIE
BitField.description: Rollover Interrupt Enable. The ROVIE bit controls the Rollover interrupt.

Enum.name: ROVIE_0
Enum.description: Rollover interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: ROVIE_1
Enum.description: Rollover interrupt enabled.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: Counter Value. The COUNT bits show the current count value of the GPT counter.

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: OTP write and read access address register

BitField.name: ERROR
BitField.description: Set by the controller when an access to a locked region(OTP or shadow register) is requested

BitField.name: RELOAD_SHADOWS
BitField.description: Set to force re-loading the shadow registers (HW/SW capability and LOCK)

BitField.name: WR_UNLOCK
BitField.description: Write 0x3E77 to enable OTP write accesses

BitField.name: STROBE_PROG
BitField.description: This count value specifies the strobe period in one time write OTP

BitField.name: RELAX
BitField.description: This count value specifies the time to add to all default timing parameters other than the Tpgm and Trd

BitField.name: STROBE_READ
BitField.description: This count value specifies the strobe period in one time read OTP

BitField.name: WAIT
BitField.description: This count value specifies time interval between auto read and write access in one time program

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Used to initiate a write to OTP

BitField.name: READ_FUSE
BitField.description: Used to initiate a read to OTP

BitField.name: SRK_REVOKE_LOCK
BitField.description: Shadow register write and OTP write lock for SRK_REVOKE region

BitField.name: FIELD_RETURN_LOCK
BitField.description: Shadow register write and OTP write lock for FIELD_RETURN region

BitField.name: SPARE
BitField.description: Unallocated read/write bits for implementation specific software use.

BitField.name: LOCK
BitField.description: When set, all of the bits in this register are locked and can not be changed through SW programming
